      <div class="instructions"> 
       <h2>Thanks for helping keep SourceForge clean.</h2> 
       <p> <u>Screenshot instructions:</u><br> <a data-external target="_blank" href="http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/take-screen-capture-print-screen#take-screen-capture-print-screen=windows-8">Windows</a><br> <a data-external target="_blank" href="https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201361">Mac</a><br> <a data-external target="_blank" href="https://access.redhat.com/solutions/2178">Red Hat Linux</a> &nbsp; <a data-external target="_blank" href="https://help.ubuntu.com/stable/ubuntu-help/screen-shot-record.html">Ubuntu</a> </p> 
       <p> <u>Click URL instructions:</u><br> Right-click on ad, choose "Copy Link", then paste here →<br> (This may not be possible with some types of ads) </p> 
       <a class="more-info" href="https://sourceforge.net/p/forge/documentation/Report%20a%20problem%20with%20Ad%20content/" target="_blank">More information about our ad policies</a> 
      </div> 
      <form class="dropzone" action="/api/instrumentation/gpt" id="blockthisForm" method="POST"> 
       <a href="#" id="btn-blockthis-close">X</a>

       <p>Briefly describe the problem (required): <input name="XjbnONQsO09k3FvC3MgA_luQ9KwU" type="text" required> </p>

        <div class="title"> 
         <h1 itemprop="name"><a href="/p/jmri/" itemprop="url">JMRI Model Railroad Interface</a></h1> 
         <h3 class="summary"> Java applications to control a model railroad layout. </h3> 
         <h3 class="brought-by"> Brought to you by: <a href="/u/jacobsen/">jacobsen</a>, <a href="/u/kevin-dickerson/">kevin-dickerson</a>, <a href="/u/matthewharris/">matthewharris</a>, <a href="/u/plocher/">plocher</a>, <a href="/u/zoo/">zoo</a> </h3> 
        </div>
       </div> 
      </div>
     </section> 
    </div> 
   </div>

            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36385352/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Time to move jmri-developers to groups.io?</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@ma...&gt; - 2018-08-06 00:05:41</small> 
           <div class="attachments">

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>I’ve probably thrown out or lost a few emails, but I’ve got a 450MB archive of jmri-developers email going back close to the beginning:  26,834 messages (the web says there are 27355 in the SF archive).  We could start with that.Bob&gt; On Aug 5, 2018, at 3:34 PM, Alex Shepherd via Jmri-developers &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Hi Bob,&gt; &gt; Reading here: <a href="https://beta.groups.io/g/main/topic/194673#3918" rel="nofollow">https://beta.groups.io/g/main/topic/194673#3918</a> it looks like Groups.io have some facility (support person banging on keyboard?) to import mailman archives.&gt; &gt; So perhaps we just, pick a date and cut-over to the new group, disable the old group so nobody can post and they will get bounces to let them know… then export the archives and get them imported into Groups.io.&gt; &gt; We might get some duplication but at least they will be searchable…&gt; &gt; Let me know if you want some help&gt; &gt; HTH&gt; &gt; Alex Shepherd&gt;  --Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>
        </tr>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Hi Bob,Reading here: <a href="https://beta.groups.io/g/main/topic/194673#3918" rel="nofollow">https://beta.groups.io/g/main/topic/194673#3918</a> &lt;<a href="https://beta.groups.io/g/main/topic/194673#3918>" rel="nofollow">https://beta.groups.io/g/main/topic/194673#3918&gt;</a>; it looks like Groups.io &lt;<a href="http://groups.io/>" rel="nofollow">http://groups.io/&gt;</a>; have some facility (support person banging on keyboard?) to import mailman archives.So perhaps we just, pick a date and cut-over to the new group, disable the old group so nobody can post and they will get bounces to let them know… then export the archives and get them imported into Groups.io.We might get some duplication but at least they will be searchable…Let me know if you want some helpHTHAlex Shepherd &gt; On 6/08/2018, at 10:21 AM, Steve G &lt;RailRodder@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Go simple.         <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>I have downloaded things from other web sites before, so my guess is that's possible to scrape the archive without too much trouble.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Sooner is better, although it should wait until after the NMRA convention.Dave Sand&gt; On Aug 5, 2018, at 3:59 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; I think perhaps it’s time to move the jmri-developers list to the groups.io platform.  This is because (1) more and more people are having incremental problems with the SourceForge lists and I’m tired of dealing with that and (2) SourceForge seems to be getting less and less reliable; I’d rather move _before_ the next big outage rather than during.  In the last week, I’ve had to reset three accounts that got messed up due to SF.net mailer problems (and we have some more I haven’t figured out how to fix), but what really broke the camel’s back what this mornings screw up.&gt; &gt; Matt Harris handled this for moving the jmriusers list from Yahoo, and it went quite well.  I’m sure Matt had to solve some problems, but we transferred pretty quickly. Unfortunately, the SourceForge -&gt; groups.io move probably won’t be as clean for this list (or we maybe would have done it before now)&gt; &gt; A) AFAIK, there isn’t a way to move the subscribers over automatically.  SourceForge no longer allows admins to see the member lists. (Apparently, they have a unique understanding of GDPR) &gt; &gt; B) There doesn’t seem to be a way to move the message archive either.&gt; &gt; The only other disadvantage I can think of is a loss of diversity of communications:  If groups.io goes away, we don’t have another solid email channel.  But we keep backups of the jmriusers groups.io address list so we can regroup even if groups.io disappears, and that would work for a jmri-developers that was hosted there.&gt; &gt; For (B), I think the best we can do is to point to the existing archive at <a href="https://sourceforge.net/p/jmri/mailman/jmri-developers/" rel="nofollow">https://sourceforge.net/p/jmri/mailman/jmri-developers/</a> unless somebody wants to write some code to scrape that.&gt; &gt; The jmri-developers on groups.io list is already up, and it’s getting a feed from jmri-developers; anything posted here for the past couple weeks has been appearing there.   (We could probably also reverse-feed groups.io back to SourceForge, but I want to avoid an infinite loop)&gt; &gt; For (A), I haven’t been able to think of a plan that works better than “Have a particular date when we want to move conversations, and do that”,  Would appreciate thoughts on this.  Issues:&gt; *) You can subscribe to both, but you’ll get duplicate copies of posts to the SourceForge group.&gt; *) If you move early, and post only to groups.io, people who move later won’t see it.&gt; *) If you move early, and unsubscribe to SrouceForge, you can’t post to SourceForge so everybody can see it.&gt; &gt; Can we just go with the simplest possible approach? "On a decided date or before, after lots of reminders, everybody moves over, and we lock this (SourceForge) list”&gt; &gt; Bob&gt; --&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36385300/">[Jmri-developers] Time to move jmri-developers to groups.io?</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@ma...&gt; - 2018-08-05 20:59:48</small> 
           <div class="attachments">

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>I think perhaps it’s time to move the jmri-developers list to the groups.io platform.  This is because (1) more and more people are having incremental problems with the SourceForge lists and I’m tired of dealing with that and (2) SourceForge seems to be getting less and less reliable; I’d rather move _before_ the next big outage rather than during.  In the last week, I’ve had to reset three accounts that got messed up due to SF.net mailer problems (and we have some more I haven’t figured out how to fix), but what really broke the camel’s back what this mornings screw up.Matt Harris handled this for moving the jmriusers list from Yahoo, and it went quite well.  I’m sure Matt had to solve some problems, but we transferred pretty quickly. Unfortunately, the SourceForge -&gt; groups.io move probably won’t be as clean for this list (or we maybe would have done it before now)A) AFAIK, there isn’t a way to move the subscribers over automatically.  SourceForge no longer allows admins to see the member lists. (Apparently, they have a unique understanding of GDPR) B) There doesn’t seem to be a way to move the message archive either.The only other disadvantage I can think of is a loss of diversity of communications:  If groups.io goes away, we don’t have another solid email channel.  But we keep backups of the jmriusers groups.io address list so we can regroup even if groups.io disappears, and that would work for a jmri-developers that was hosted there.For (B), I think the best we can do is to point to the existing archive at <a href="https://sourceforge.net/p/jmri/mailman/jmri-developers/" rel="nofollow">https://sourceforge.net/p/jmri/mailman/jmri-developers/</a> unless somebody wants to write some code to scrape that.The jmri-developers on groups.io list is already up, and it’s getting a feed from jmri-developers; anything posted here for the past couple weeks has been appearing there.   (We could probably also reverse-feed groups.io back to SourceForge, but I want to avoid an infinite loop)For (A), I haven’t been able to think of a plan that works better than “Have a particular date when we want to move conversations, and do that”,  Would appreciate thoughts on this.  Issues:*) You can subscribe to both, but you’ll get duplicate copies of posts to the SourceForge group.*) If you move early, and post only to groups.io, people who move later won’t see it.*) If you move early, and unsubscribe to SrouceForge, you can’t post to SourceForge so everybody can see it.Can we just go with the simplest possible approach? "On a decided date or before, after lots of reminders, everybody moves over, and we lock this (SourceForge) list”Bob--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36385149/">[Jmri-developers] Information to test writers</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: &lt;db123@be...&gt; - 2018-08-05 15:27:17</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Due to issue #5359 and PR #5604, null profile is no longer valid. ProfileManager.getActiveProfile() will now throw an exception instead of returning null if there is no current profile. Therefore new tests may break if they don't setup a profile. This results in a NullPointerException: "NullPointer activeProfile is null". This can be solved by adding a call to resetProfileManager() in setUp().Example from jmri.configurexml.LoadAndStoreTestBase.java:@Beforepublic void setUp() {     JUnitUtil.setUp();     JUnitUtil.resetProfileManager();     JUnitUtil.initConfigureManager();     JUnitUtil.initInternalTurnoutManager();     JUnitUtil.initInternalLightManager();     JUnitUtil.initInternalSensorManager();     JUnitUtil.initMemoryManager();}<a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/issues/5359" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/issues/5359</a><a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5604" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5604</a>RegardsDaniel</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,The results of these tests are inconclusive. There was still a delay even after the font checks had concluded. The delays seem to have moved around some.Something else has broken with R2f3476e. There are no events at all logged as 'R:'. (from the layout) Everything shown has an 'S:' indicating it is from JMRI. There is still a traffic burst on the bus, and the aspects are all shown correctly, so it is apparently just a traffic monitor glitch. The monitor also still has a substantial delay between when the traffic happens and when it appears in the display.When a turnout is changed on the layout (with a local button) it triggers off a string of events that appear immediately in the traffic monitor window. (with no noticeable delay at all) The panel updates immediately as well. Also all the events are tagged as 'R:' so the traffic monitor operates normally at that point.Using the panel icon to throw the same turnouts also acts and displays all the events instantly as best as my mouse click to eyeball reaction time can tell. The 'S:' and 'R:' tags are as expected. One 'S:' followed by a number of 'R:' entries as the signals react. (signal logic is in the nodes)How is the monitor different when recording the producer consumer query data as the panel loads, and when processing normal events? Is it monitoring the actual traffic.I'm going to have to drop out of this testing for tonight. Karen expects me to pack up the layout so we can head out for KC tomorrow AM.Dick :)On 08/02/2018 06:49 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers wrote:&gt; Do I understand correctly that it does get the right results on the screen?&gt;&gt; A few seconds to open and parse the file, then a few second really busy period to do all the sensor/turnout/signal creation I/O, then putting up the panel sounds about right.&gt;&gt; Don’t know why the monitor activity waited so long after, though.  That might be some kind of thread priority inversion problem but a quick scan of that code didn’t show it.&gt;&gt; #24 in the usual place has a small threading priority change that might help, might not.&gt;&gt; It would be interesting to know a couple things:&gt;&gt; A) Try, just as a diagnostic, waiting for the font work to be done before opening the panel.  Does that help the delay?&gt;&gt; B) Try opening the panel file _again_, a second time.  Is there a delay then?  There will be a lot less traffic, but there should be some, and it would be interesting to see if that traffic was promptly displayed.&gt;&gt; Bob&gt;</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Do I understand correctly that it does get the right results on the screen?A few seconds to open and parse the file, then a few second really busy period to do all the sensor/turnout/signal creation I/O, then putting up the panel sounds about right.  Don’t know why the monitor activity waited so long after, though.  That might be some kind of thread priority inversion problem but a quick scan of that code didn’t show it.#24 in the usual place has a small threading priority change that might help, might not.  It would be interesting to know a couple things:A) Try, just as a diagnostic, waiting for the font work to be done before opening the panel.  Does that help the delay?B) Try opening the panel file _again_, a second time.  Is there a delay then?  There will be a lot less traffic, but there should be some, and it would be interesting to see if that traffic was promptly displayed.Bob&gt; On Aug 2, 2018, at 3:07 PM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Bob,&gt; &gt; Now I'm really puzzled. &gt; The data I sent before was just a sample to show the repeats that didn't happen to include any packets from the layout. (they were there mixed into the messages from JMRI)&gt; &gt; The above seems to be more like I would expect to see. I just don't understand why the monitor waited so long to show it up when obviously the actual traffic had already happened. The data rate above also seems more reasonable at 5,000 packets per second.&gt; &gt; I just tried it again without logging to a file.&gt; a.) Startup JMRI&gt; b.) Startup traffic monitor&gt; c.) Open panel file&gt; d.) After a few seconds delay there is a burst of network traffic indicated by activity lights.&gt; e.) A few more seconds pass, then the panel window opens with all the aspects correct.&gt; f.) More than 10 seconds later the traffic monitor window fills with the data that obviously was read back at d.) 10-15 seconds previously.&gt; &gt; Note, I did not wait for the font processing to finish before doing this. (I would miss getting to KC in time for my clinic if I waited for that every time I start) &lt;G&gt; Also note that this is on my old (slow) Linux box. After a few seconds delay there is a burst of network traffic indicated by activity lights.e.) A few more seconds pass, then the panel window opens with all the aspects correct.f.) More than 10 seconds later the traffic monitor window fills with the data that obviously was read back at d.) 10-15 seconds previously.Note, I did not wait for the font processing to finish before doing this.             <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36383309/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Help with checking SignalMast Add/Edit changes</a></b>

           <small>From: Dave Sand &lt;dave@sa...&gt; - 2018-08-02 22:02:09</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> <b>Attachments:</b> <a href="/p/jmri/mailman/attachment/B3489439-CC2C-45B3-9280-2C0FFCA5AB71%40sandsys.org/1/">Message as HTML</a> </small>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Currently, if the custom signal system name matches a standard signal system name, the aspects.xml file from the standard system will be used.  The user appearance…xml files will be used.   If changes to the aspects.xml file are required, a new signal system name has to be used.An unrelated recommendation:  The appearance xml file icon references should be program: instead of ../../../Dave Sand&gt; On Aug 2, 2018, at 4:15 PM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; I see it as what the general case of user vs program contents should be, and&gt; it should be consistent regardless of the item. So in the case of signals,&gt; I'd think if there is one in the user space, it wins and gets used. But I&gt; also think it may be worth a log message. The discussion as I recall was&gt; somebody uses a custom item to work around an issue with some file in the&gt; program. Later the program gets fixed and improved. Unless the user file is&gt; removed, the user file still gets used instead of the program file. Other&gt; idea than logging would be an option that points out what came from the user&gt; space. It would search and build the listing rather than something&gt; maintained by the loading, but if it was simpler to track what came from&gt; user, maybe go that way.&gt; &gt; But to me, it should be the same idea for signals, decoders, icons, etc...&gt; something common and consistent.&gt; &gt; -Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team&gt; <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a>&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

           <small>From: Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@tw...&gt; - 2018-08-02 21:15:23</small>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>I see it as what the general case of user vs program contents should be, andit should be consistent regardless of the item. So in the case of signals,I'd think if there is one in the user space, it wins and gets used. But Ialso think it may be worth a log message. The discussion as I recall wassomebody uses a custom item to work around an issue with some file in theprogram. Later the program gets fixed and improved. Unless the user file isremoved, the user file still gets used instead of the program file. Otheridea than logging would be an option that points out what came from the userspace. It would search and build the listing rather than somethingmaintained by the loading, but if it was simpler to track what came fromuser, maybe go that way.But to me, it should be the same idea for signals, decoders, icons, etc...something common and consistent.-Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a> <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a> <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a> <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a></pre></td>
        </tr>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Thanks!There are several places in the code that reference the signal specification files. Eventually, I’d like to centralize this so that things like this don’t happen.But a question arises:  How to handle definitions that are in both the program and user directories?  Which gets precedence?  And should that be precedence in part (look for each file in one place or the other) or completely (take the signal system from just one place, even if additional files are in the other place)?  I don’t work with enough custom signaling to know what’s best.Bob&gt; On Aug 2, 2018, at 1:39 PM, Dave Sand &lt;dave@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Build 22 resolved this issue.&gt; &gt; Dave Sand&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt; On Aug 1, 2018, at 11:23 AM, Dave Sand &lt;dave@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; The aspect numbers are being set properly for both standard and custom signal systems.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Changing the aspect numbers and saving the changes works for standard systems but creates a Java exception for custom systems.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;Screen Shot 2018-08-01 at 10.50.58 AM.png&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; The problem appears to be that the Mast Type is missing, probably causing the Java exception.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; The attached file is different this time.  It is a complete profile and includes the custom signal mast system, a panel xml file with two masts and the session.log file with the Java exception.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; The custom signal mast system, SPTCO-2018, is a copy of SPTCO-1930 with only the names changed and the icon references changed from ../../../ to program:.&gt;&gt; --Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

Setting the correct values and saving is successful.&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; If a custom signal mast system is used, the create issue also exists.&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; An attempt to edit in order to fix the aspect numbers generates a Java exception and the edit window is not displayed.&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Another DEBUG session.log file is attached.&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Dave Sand&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;session.log.tgz&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On Jul 31, 2018, at 11:44 AM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks again to the people helping with this.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; There’s a new build at <a href="http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/" rel="nofollow">http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/</a>  #17 that has the fix for the problem that DaveS found, and also has the implementation for SignalHeadSignalMast (Signal Head Controlled Mast) add/edit.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; It’s still missing MatrixMast support; that’s probably a few days away, perhaps this weekend.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Feedback greatly appreciated, particularly if you can reproducibly break it.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Bob&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; --&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org!          <td class="email-body"><pre>Interesting timing.The might be several things going on to cause the duplications. The 00.00.00.00.00.00.00.00 are probably a holdover from earlier code, I added something to handle that, so #23 building now shouldn’t be spending line time on those.I don’t see the "Producer Identified Valid * 3; Producer Identified Unknown; repeat for Consumer” sequence here.  Not sure why that’s happening. The short gap after the 1st three is particularly mystifying.  Does it happen for all the signal heads?Bob&gt; On Aug 2, 2018, at 10:37 AM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Bob,&gt; I tested on build #22. Sorry for the delay in responding. I proceeded to remove all the old entries and the unused turnout entries just to be sure when testing.&gt; &gt; I pronounce it cured! The cleaned up panel loads correctly, and it is so fast that it appears to load all the mast's aspects virtually simultaneously. In the past, at least on my machine it would load, then change the 'X' entries to valid entries one at a time as you watched.&gt; &gt; I suppose that all your refactoring work has helped improve the load time, and the OLCB data rate can't hurt any either. I logged and timed the identify producers and consumers process, and it was 1.091 seconds for 10 double headed masts, 4 turnouts, and 12 blocks. Many sections of the log showed about 15,000 messages per second. That appears to make OpenLCB about 20-25 times the data rate of DCC. I didn't realize that it was that fast.&gt; &gt; Also there seems to be a lot of duplication in the log:&gt; &gt; 13:26:08.907: [[1954438c] 02 01 57 10 00 06 01 E8]  S: 02.01.12.FE.54.1A                     Producer Identified Valid for EventID:02.01.57.10.00.06.01.E8&gt;          <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,I tested on build #22. Sorry for the delay in responding. I proceeded to remove all the old entries and the unused turnout entries just to be sure when testing.I pronounce it cured! The cleaned up panel loads correctly, and it is so fast that it appears to load all the mast's aspects virtually simultaneously. In the past, at least on my machine it would load, then change the 'X' entries to valid entries one at a time as you watched.I suppose that all your refactoring work has helped improve the load time, and the OLCB data rate can't hurt any either. I logged and timed the identify producers and consumers process, and it was 1.091 seconds for 10 double headed masts, 4 turnouts, and 12 blocks. Many sections of the log showed about 15,000 messages per second. That appears to make OpenLCB about 20-25 times the data rate of DCC. I didn't realize that it was that fast.Also there seems to be a lot of duplication in the log:13:26:08.907: [[1954438c] 02 01 57 10 00 06 01 E8]&nbsp; S: 02.01.12.FE.54.1A&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;          <td class="email-body"><pre>Thank you!  I didn’t have much experience with MatrixMast, and wasn’t sure of what nooks and crannies to test.          <td class="email-header"> 
          <div> 
           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36382927/">Re: [Jmri-developers] OpenLCB SignalMast operation (was Re: Help with checking SignalMast Add/Edit changes</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@ma...&gt; - 2018-08-02 15:10:01</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Thanks!  The detail really helps, as I had managed to confuse myself about what you were seeing.The problem was that the Identified/Identify messages weren’t being properly emitted.  (The tests only checked after startup, not during startup, so didn’t catch this).I think this is fixed in the #21 installers at <a href="http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/" rel="nofollow">http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/</a>  That’s currently building, should be done in a few minutes.Bob&gt; On Aug 1, 2018, at 7:14 PM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Bob,&gt; a.) A JMRI panel is started first, signals etc. are all shown as unknown on the panel. Then the layout is started up. Signals, turnouts, sensors, all report their last states to JMRI as they power up, and the panel updates to match the layout. This works as expected.&gt; &gt; b.) The layout is started first, or already running. Then a JMRI panel is loaded. Turnouts and sensors are queried by JMRI and their panel images update. (as expected) However the signal images remain as unknown until something else causes them to change. E.g. logic in JMRI, logic in another copy of JMRI, or logic on the layout. In the latter two cases the signal state is already known and the panel needs to find it out, but can not.&gt; &gt; When our OLCB signals power up they always default to the last known aspect. If node based logic is controlling them, then they may change based on finding local conditions to be different than when the layout was powered down, or maybe the layout was not powered down at all when JMRI was restarted for some reason. (like making changes to a panel to get ready for a clinic presentation) &lt;VBG&gt;&gt; &gt; My understanding of the situation is that; the panel does not 'update' itself (display proper aspects instead of 'X') because it does not 'query' the events used for the signal aspects. This is one sentence, not two different thoughts one vs another.&gt; &gt; I have come to that conclusion because when the same EventIDs were duplicated in a turnout table, then it worked properly, apparently because the turnout table queried the events, and the OLCB mast saw the results. As I removed these old duplicate entries from the turnout table, it stopped the panel icons from updating. (synchronizing, whatever) At first it was only one, then two that failed. After I had cleaned up some more cruft, I realized that my house cleaning was causing the failures.&gt; &gt; Dick :)&gt; &gt; On 08/01/2018 09:28 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers wrote:&gt;&gt; (Changed the subject line)&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; On Aug 1, 2018, at 6:21 PM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; It isn't about where the logic resides. It is about JMRI starting up and synchronizing itself with the layout. For example with LocoNet it sends messages that cause the layout hardware to report the status of sensors and turnouts. With OLCB it does similar things to get the status of sensors and turnouts. However it does not query for the status of the OLCB signals. (by checking their events)&gt;&gt; I agree that pieces can query each other.  But I’m confused about what you’re seeing _happen_.  You’re notes have separately mentioned JMRI starting (this one) and hardware off/on (last one), and data not updating vs “does not query”.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; So let’s try to pin this down.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; *) What’s the sequence of operations you’re doing? (Let’s start with one that’s not working as expected, sort that out, and from there)&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; *) At each step, what’s sent on the line?&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; *) At each step, what happens? Is that expected or unexpected?&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Thanks&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Bob&gt;&gt; --&gt;&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt;&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt;&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt;&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt;&gt; _______________________________________________&gt;&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt;&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt;&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Ken,Once the OLCB signals act as a peer node, then I think that you can probably do away with any scripts to poke things into responding. The OLCB protocol seems to be pretty good at dealing with random startup order. I think the OLCB masts should be able to use the same messages as the turnout and sensor tables do. The signal nodes respond properly with the active aspect's event info.I never noticed it because I had all the same EventIDs in turnout commands originally. As many have already found, those old entries tend to hang around in the panel files long after they are needed, so things appeared to be working fine with the new OLCB masts. It was only when I started to clean out the no longer used turnout entries that I discovered any issues.Dick :)On 08/01/2018 10:56 PM, Ken Cameron wrote:&gt; Dick,&gt;&gt; If that's the case, it might explain why one part of the layout works&gt; differently from the other. On the first part of the layout, I setup single&gt; event sensors for each of the mast aspects and two event sensors to match&gt; the is/isn't pairs for each aspect. It was very handy for testing and&gt; sim/stim of the layout. But the second half, I didn't bother with all of&gt; them, only some of them. So the second half initializes differently when&gt; viewed by the JMRI panel. Unfortunately, that layout I'm not going to be&gt; back to until after the convention and a bit. The owner is going to KC (via&gt; Amtrak) and then on to CA as I recall. So a few weeks until he gets back. So&gt; I don't have a way to confirm any of this, just what I felt I thought I&gt; might have seen.&gt;&gt; I should also add that the usual case has the layout powered before JMRI&gt; starts. So normal case, the panel loads after the nodes did their normal P/C&gt; identify and query stuff. Now one point is that JMRI was much happier after&gt; I did a bunch of node resets. Was thinking of writing  script to generate&gt; the node resets just to save time. Haven't got to that yet.&gt;&gt; -Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team&gt; <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a>&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Dick,If that's the case, it might explain why one part of the layout worksdifferently from the other. On the first part of the layout, I setup singleevent sensors for each of the mast aspects and two event sensors to matchthe is/isn't pairs for each aspect. It was very handy for testing andsim/stim of the layout. But the second half, I didn't bother with all ofthem, only some of them. So the second half initializes differently whenviewed by the JMRI panel. Unfortunately, that layout I'm not going to beback to until after the convention and a bit. The owner is going to KC (viaAmtrak) and then on to CA as I recall. So a few weeks until he gets back. SoI don't have a way to confirm any of this, just what I felt I thought Imight have seen.I should also add that the usual case has the layout powered before JMRIstarts. So normal case, the panel loads after the nodes did their normal P/Cidentify and query stuff. Now one point is that JMRI was much happier afterI did a bunch of node resets. Was thinking of writing  script to generatethe node resets just to save time.            <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36382376/">Re: [Jmri-developers] OpenLCB SignalMast operation (was Re: Help with checking SignalMast Add/Edit changes</a></b>
           </div>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,a.) A JMRI panel is started first, signals etc. are all shown as unknown on the panel. Then the layout is started up. Signals, turnouts, sensors, all report their last states to JMRI as they power up, and the panel updates to match the layout. This works as expected.b.) The layout is started first, or already running. Then a JMRI panel is loaded. Turnouts and sensors are queried by JMRI and their panel images update. (as expected) However the signal images remain as unknown until something else causes them to change. E.g. logic in JMRI, logic in another copy of JMRI, or logic on the layout. In the latter two cases the signal state is already known and the panel needs to find it out, but can not.When our OLCB signals power up they always default to the last known aspect. If node based logic is controlling them, then they may change based on finding local conditions to be different than when the layout was powered down, or maybe the layout was not powered down at all when JMRI was restarted for some reason. (like making changes to a panel to get ready for a clinic presentation) &lt;VBG&gt;My understanding of the situation is that; the panel does not 'update' itself (display proper aspects instead of 'X') because it does not 'query' the events used for the signal aspects. This is one sentence, not two different thoughts one vs another.I have come to that conclusion because when the same EventIDs were duplicated in a turnout table, then it worked properly, apparently because the turnout table queried the events, and the OLCB mast saw the results. As I removed these old duplicate entries from the turnout table, it stopped the panel icons from updating. (synchronizing, whatever) At first it was only one, then two that failed. After I had cleaned up some more cruft, I realized that my house cleaning was causing the failures.Dick :)On 08/01/2018 09:28 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers wrote:&gt; (Changed the subject line)&gt;&gt;&gt; On Aug 1, 2018, at 6:21 PM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; It isn't about where the logic resides. It is about JMRI starting up and synchronizing itself with the layout. For example with LocoNet it sends messages that cause the layout hardware to report the status of sensors and turnouts. With OLCB it does similar things to get the status of sensors and turnouts. However it does not query for the status of the OLCB signals. (by checking their events)&gt; I agree that pieces can query each other.  But I’m confused about what you’re seeing _happen_.  You’re notes have separately mentioned JMRI starting (this one) and hardware off/on (last one), and data not updating vs “does not query”.&gt;&gt; So let’s try to pin this down.&gt;&gt; *) What’s the sequence of operations you’re doing? (Let’s start with one that’s not working as expected, sort that out, and from there)&gt;&gt; *) At each step, what’s sent on the line?&gt;&gt; *) At each step, what happens? Is that expected or unexpected?&gt;&gt; Thanks&gt;&gt; Bob&gt; --&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

With OLCB it does similar things to get the status of sensors and turnouts. However it does not query for the status of the OLCB signals.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,It isn't about where the logic resides. It is about JMRI starting up and synchronizing itself with the layout. For example with LocoNet it sends messages that cause the layout hardware to report the status of sensors and turnouts. With OLCB it does similar things to get the status of sensors and turnouts. However it does not query for the status of the OLCB signals. (by checking their events)Dick :)On 08/01/2018 08:56 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers wrote:&gt; Where’s the logic coming from?&gt;&gt; If it’s in JMRI, then I would have expected that turning the signal hardware off wouldn’t change the JMRI panel. (But it might if that hardware was doing other things too) Then, when the signal hardware comes back on, it’ll get updated to whatever JMRI thinks is the correct state.&gt;&gt; Is that not what’s happening?&gt;&gt; If the logic is in the hardware, I’m not sure what the JMRI panel would do.  OpenLCB doesn’t have a way to promptly notice that a node had gone away during normal operations.&gt;&gt; Bob&gt;</pre></td>
        </tr>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Where’s the logic coming from?If it’s in JMRI, then I would have expected that turning the signal hardware off wouldn’t change the JMRI panel. (But it might if that hardware was doing other things too) Then, when the signal hardware comes back on, it’ll get updated to whatever JMRI thinks is the correct state.Is that not what’s happening?If the logic is in the hardware, I’m not sure what the JMRI panel would do.  OpenLCB doesn’t have a way to promptly notice that a node had gone away during normal operations.Bob&gt; On Aug 1, 2018, at 3:53 PM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Bob,&gt; When OLCB nodes start up they send info about themselves, including any event information. Then they query for information that is of interest.&gt; &gt; I just tested and if I power down the layout nodes, then power them up again, then the signal images on the panel appear (no longer 'X') and match the hardware. The remaining 'X' entries (see attached) do not have attached hardware.&gt; &gt; Dick :)&gt; &gt; On 08/01/2018 06:33 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers wrote:&gt;&gt; Could you say a bit more about why you mean by “synchronized”?&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Bob&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; On Aug 1, 2018, at 3:21 PM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; As I have been converting to the new OLCB signal masts, I have also been cleaning up the panel file by removing unused turnout table entries left over from previous turnout based control. Today I realized that more and more of my panels signal icons are failing to synchronize with the hardware like they did in the past. A bit of sleuthing reveals that turnout (and presumably sensor) table events are synchronized at startup. However EventIDs only used by the OpenLCB masts do not.&gt;&gt; --&gt;&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt;&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt;&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt;&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt;&gt; _______________________________________________&gt;&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt;&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt;&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>&gt; &gt; &gt; &lt;Screenshot from 2018-08-01 18-51-11.png&gt;------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot_______________________________________________" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot_______________________________________________</a>&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Dick,this behavior seems to be fine to me.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,When OLCB nodes start up they send info about themselves, including any event information. Then they query for information that is of interest.I just tested and if I power down the layout nodes, then power them up again, then the signal images on the panel appear (no longer 'X') and match the hardware. The remaining 'X' entries (see attached) do not have attached hardware.Dick :)On 08/01/2018 06:33 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers wrote:&gt; Could you say a bit more about why you mean by “synchronized”?&gt;&gt; Bob&gt;&gt;&gt; On Aug 1, 2018, at 3:21 PM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; As I have been converting to the new OLCB signal masts, I have also been cleaning up the panel file by removing unused turnout table entries left over from previous turnout based control.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,As I have been converting to the new OLCB signal masts, I have also been cleaning up the panel file by removing unused turnout table entries left over from previous turnout based control. Today I realized that more and more of my panels signal icons are failing to synchronize with the hardware like they did in the past. A bit of sleuthing reveals that turnout (and presumably sensor) table events are synchronized at startup. However EventIDs only used by the OpenLCB masts do not.Dick :)</pre></td>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Dropbox is not a Cloud Storage solution, it is a Cloud-Synced local storage solution. Every computer maintains a full local copy and can be used standalone. The Cloud is only used to sync the multiple local copies.Sent from my iPad-- DaveThe New England Convention 2018<a href="http://www.newenglandmodelrailwayclub.com/content/convention.shtml" rel="nofollow">http://www.newenglandmodelrailwayclub.com/content/convention.shtml</a>&gt; On 2 Aug 2018, at 1:46 AM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Does Dropbox work over a local area network that is never connected to the&gt; real world? By taking the computers home, I can have them online for&gt; updates, or I use USB drives to bring updates to the club.</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table> 
      <table id="msg36382231">
       <tbody>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-header"> 
          <div> 
           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36382231/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Creating 2nd profile for simulator: How to on website?</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Dave Heap &lt;dgheap@gm...&gt; - 2018-08-01 22:06:11</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>&gt; On 2 Aug 2018, at 1:46 AM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Does Dropbox work over a local area network that is never connected to the&gt; real world? By taking the computers home, I can have them online for&gt; updates, or I use USB drives to bring updates to the club.You can use the Dropbox solution for infrequently connected computers, but updates (syncing) will only happen if an Internet connection is present to sync with the master copy, even though the actual file transfers will occur over LAN if possible. (There is no need for simultaneous connection.)&gt; &gt; I'm thinking a similar page for the case of live vs simulated would be more&gt; user friendly. Since they are on the same compute, you wouldn't have both&gt; open at once. So I think I've usually just created a new profile and then&gt; copy the users and roster paths to the new profile. I don't recall what else&gt; I usually did.Moving the user files to a folder outside profile: (settings: is fine, or anywhere else on the computer) is far better. Then you can create new profiles with a couple of clicks, no copying required.&gt; &gt; But which part of the help is the Dropbox page? The simple clone for&gt; simulation should be off the same index page I figure.For multiple profiles, you don't clone the user data. You move the data to a common location (a folder you create any where).You follow the Dropbox instructions exactly but instead of creating a "C:\Users\xxx\Dropbox\JMRI\" folder you create something like "C:\Users\xxx\Shared JMRI Files\". That's the only difference.Once you've configured your JMRI as per those instructions, it's only a matter of seconds to create new profiles using the Profile Copy command. The data sharing is automatic.I have 10 or more computers/VMs sharing my JMRI files via a Dropbox folder. If I take my laptop to a show, I just have to make sure I connect it to the Internet at some subsequent stage to propagate any changes.A multiple-profiles help page would be Step 1 of the Dropbox instructions with two or three words in the first two sentences changed, plus a new Step 2 that says something like: "go to Preferences-&gt;Config Profiles , select, Copy, restart and change connection settings. </pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>The aspect numbers are being set properly for both standard and custom signal systems.Changing the aspect numbers and saving the changes works for standard systems but creates a Java exception for custom systems.The problem appears to be that the Mast Type is missing, probably causing the Java exception.The attached file is different this time.  It is a complete profile and includes the custom signal mast system, a panel xml file with two masts and the session.log file with the Java exception.The custom signal mast system, SPTCO-2018, is a copy of SPTCO-1930 with only the names changed and the icon references changed from ../../../ to program:.Dave Sand&gt; On Aug 1, 2018, at 12:09 AM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Thanks again!&gt; &gt; I think I’ve got some fixes for this in #19 at <a href="http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/" rel="nofollow">http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/</a>  which is building now and should be complete shortly.&gt; &gt; Not entirely sure I go the problem with the custom signal definition. If it’s still causing trouble, could you send along those files, please?&gt; &gt; Thanks again.&gt; &gt; Bob&gt; &gt;&gt; On Jul 31, 2018, at 1:03 PM, Dave Sand &lt;dave@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; The multiple add problem is fixed.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; I expanded my testing to include DCC Signal Masts.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; The aspect number fields are not populated.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;Screen Shot 2018-07-31 at 2.23.47 PM.png&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; When the mast is edited, the values are -1.  Setting the correct values and saving is successful.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; If a custom signal mast system is used, the create issue also exists.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; An attempt to edit in order to fix the aspect numbers generates a Java exception and the edit window is not displayed.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Another DEBUG session.log file is attached.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Dave Sand&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;session.log.tgz&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; On Jul 31, 2018, at 11:44 AM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks again to the people helping with this.&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; There’s a new build at <a href="http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/" rel="nofollow">http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/</a>  #17 that has the fix for the problem that DaveS found, and also has the implementation for SignalHeadSignalMast (Signal Head Controlled Mast) add/edit.&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; It’s still missing MatrixMast support; that’s probably a few days away, perhaps this weekend.&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Feedback greatly appreciated, particularly if you can reproducibly break it.&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Bob&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; --&gt;&gt;&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt;&gt;&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt;&gt;&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt;&gt;&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org!         </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>The trick is to move User Files Location (and Roster Location) out from within Profile Location. The technique for doing this is described in detail (with illustrations) in our Dropbox help page. The process is the same irrespective of where the destination folder is:&lt;<a href="http://jmri.org/help/en/html/setup/Dropbox.shtml>" rel="nofollow">http://jmri.org/help/en/html/setup/Dropbox.shtml&gt;</a>;Once you have done that it's simply a matter of highlighting the existing profile in Preferences-&gt;Config Profile, right-clicking and choosing Copy. Once you restart into the new profile you can simply change the connection type. This can then be done ad infinitum to create as many profiles as you desire (I probably have around 20).Sent from my iPad-- DaveThe New England Convention 2018<a href="http://www.newenglandmodelrailwayclub.com/content/convention.shtml" rel="nofollow">http://www.newenglandmodelrailwayclub.com/content/convention.shtml</a>&gt; On 1 Aug 2018, at 9:37 PM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; I think you've posted a checklist for how to clone a profile, like setting&gt; up a simulated connection, and get all the other paths changed correctly.&gt; Did it ever get added to the JMRI website? If so, where? I tried a few&gt; different search words and struck out.</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Thank you!  Particularly appreciate the trace.Bob&gt; On Jul 30, 2018, at 1:51 PM, Dave Sand &lt;dave@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; I am able to add one virtual mast but not a second one within the same JMRI session.  If I save/stop/start, then I can add another one.&gt; &gt; There are no messages when this occurs.  The attached session log is with global debug enabled.  If you want I can narrow it down to a smaller set of classes.  I fixed the BR-2003 problem in this test, but the add failure was occurring before I fixed BR-2003.&gt; &gt; I added lines to the log to indicate the actions taken.&gt; &gt; Dave Sand&gt; &gt; &gt; &lt;session.log&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt; On Jul 29, 2018, at 10:20 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; I’m rewriting the code that handles adding and editing of SignalMasts from the SignalMast table. It’s part way done.  I’ve managed to simplify a 2600-line monolith with over 400 "if” clauses to several smaller, simpler classes with much less complex logic.  In the process, I’ve found &amp; fixed a bunch of weird behaviors that I think were bugs. &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; I couldn’t tell whether one thing was a bug or not:  When you click “Edit” on the table, you can’t change the user name sometimes, but you can at others.  Was that intended for some reason? Sensors and Turnouts do let you directly edit the user name always.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Although this is _NOT_ done yet, see below, I’d appreciate people trying it out when they have a chance.  There are installers at:&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; <a href="http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/" rel="nofollow">http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/</a>&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; or you can checkout and build the `signalmast-add-refactor` branch from JMRI GitHub.  These are current with JMRI 4.13.1.  &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; I’d appreciate people who use VirtualSignalMast, TurnoutSignalMast, DccSignalMast and LNCPSignalMast, along with the brand-new OlcbSignalMast, giving this a look. I’d like to include it in JMRI 4.13.2 in a few weeks, but it’s an extensive enough change that a look from knowledgable (and tolerant) eyes would be appreciated before I do that.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Please note that you WILL NOT be able to add or edit two specific kinds of SignalMasts with this: SignalHeadSignalMast and MatrixSignalMast.  I’m still working on that code, have a few more known bugs to get out.  Those masts will work fine, they’ll load and store as always.  You just can’t add or edit them. If you try to, they’ll show as blank windows because I don’t want to accidentally corrupt people’s panel files if they hit one of the remaining bugs and then store. Hope to have these by the end of the week.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Thanks for considering this, and thanks in advance for the help.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Bob&gt;&gt; --&gt;&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt;&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt;&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt;&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt;&gt; _______________________________________________&gt;&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt;&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt;&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>&gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot_______________________________________________" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot_______________________________________________</a>&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,As a quick first glance it seems to open both OLCB turnout controlled masts and OLCB event controlled masts for editing. I'll check more tomorrow.Thanks,Dick :)On 07/29/2018 11:20 PM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers wrote:&gt; I’m rewriting the code that handles adding and editing of SignalMasts from the SignalMast table. It’s part way done.  I’ve managed to simplify a 2600-line monolith with over 400 "if” clauses to several smaller, simpler classes with much less complex logic.  In the process, I’ve found &amp; fixed a bunch of weird behaviors that I think were bugs.&gt;&gt; I couldn’t tell whether one thing was a bug or not:  When you click “Edit” on the table, you can’t change the user name sometimes, but you can at others.  Was that intended for some reason? Sensors and Turnouts do let you directly edit the user name always.&gt;&gt; Although this is _NOT_ done yet, see below, I’d appreciate people trying it out when they have a chance.  There are installers at:&gt;&gt; <a href="http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/" rel="nofollow">http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/</a>&gt;&gt; or you can checkout and build the `signalmast-add-refactor` branch from JMRI GitHub.  These are current with JMRI 4.13.1.&gt;&gt; I’d appreciate people who use VirtualSignalMast, TurnoutSignalMast, DccSignalMast and LNCPSignalMast, along with the brand-new OlcbSignalMast, giving this a look. I’d like to include it in JMRI 4.13.2 in a few weeks, but it’s an extensive enough change that a look from knowledgable (and tolerant) eyes would be appreciated before I do that.&gt;&gt; Please note that you WILL NOT be able to add or edit two specific kinds of SignalMasts with this: SignalHeadSignalMast and MatrixSignalMast.  I’m still working on that code, have a few more known bugs to get out.  Those masts will work fine, they’ll load and store as always.  You just can’t add or edit them. If you try to, they’ll show as blank windows because I don’t want to accidentally corrupt people’s panel files if they hit one of the remaining bugs and then store. Hope to have these by the end of the week.&gt;&gt; Thanks for considering this, and thanks in advance for the help.&gt;&gt; Bob&gt; --&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table> 
      <table id="msg36379439">

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-header"> 
          <div> 
           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36379439/">[Jmri-developers] Help with checking SignalMast Add/Edit changes</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@ma...&gt; - 2018-07-30 03:21:19</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>I’m rewriting the code that handles adding and editing of SignalMasts from the SignalMast table. It’s part way done.  I’ve managed to simplify a 2600-line monolith with over 400 "if” clauses to several smaller, simpler classes with much less complex logic.  In the process, I’ve found &amp; fixed a bunch of weird behaviors that I think were bugs. I couldn’t tell whether one thing was a bug or not:  When you click “Edit” on the table, you can’t change the user name sometimes, but you can at others.  Was that intended for some reason? Sensors and Turnouts do let you directly edit the user name always.Although this is _NOT_ done yet, see below, I’d appreciate people trying it out when they have a chance.  There are installers at:<a href="http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/" rel="nofollow">http://jmri.tagadab.com/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/SignalMast-development/</a>or you can checkout and build the `signalmast-add-refactor` branch from JMRI GitHub.  These are current with JMRI 4.13.1.  I’d appreciate people who use VirtualSignalMast, TurnoutSignalMast, DccSignalMast and LNCPSignalMast, along with the brand-new OlcbSignalMast, giving this a look. I’d like to include it in JMRI 4.13.2 in a few weeks, but it’s an extensive enough change that a look from knowledgable (and tolerant) eyes would be appreciated before I do that.Please note that you WILL NOT be able to add or edit two specific kinds of SignalMasts with this: SignalHeadSignalMast and MatrixSignalMast.  I’m still working on that code, have a few more known bugs to get out.  Those masts will work fine, they’ll load and store as always.  You just can’t add or edit them. If you try to, they’ll show as blank windows because I don’t want to accidentally corrupt people’s panel files if they hit one of the remaining bugs and then store. Hope to have these by the end of the week.Thanks for considering this, and thanks in advance for the help.Bob--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,I was kind of afraid of that when you or someone mentioned that it used a new way to build masts.I'll 'cheat' the clinic images by using the branch code as if it was already available.          <td class="email-body"><pre>That `signalmast-add-refactor` branch has a completely new way of building signal masts.  I gave priority to making that work for OlcbSignalMast because there wasn’t any other implementation for them.  But people keep pushing other things to the top of the priority queue, so I haven’t had time to make work on (i.e. to unbreak) the support for the other SignalMast types.  The Matrix Mast editor, for instance, opens up as a blank window still.We’ll see what other obsessions people bring up in the next couple weeks….Bob&gt; On Jul 28, 2018, at 3:30 PM, Dick Bronson &lt;dick@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Bob,&gt; I'm disappointed that the OlcbSignalMast GUI didn't make it into 4.13.1.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,I'm disappointed that the OlcbSignalMast GUI didn't make it into 4.13.1. The development version seems to work OK.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Here’s an analogous snippet from the signalmast support:                                var icons = $(this).find('icons').children(); //get array of icons                                icons.each(function(i, item) {  //loop thru icons array and set all iconXX urls for widget                                    $widget['icon' + $(item).attr('aspect')] = $(item).attr('url');                                });It looks like the .children() call is the difference.             <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36369082/">Re: [Jmri-developers] TCS WOW with caching and/or confirm writes</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@ma...&gt; - 2018-07-16 13:57:00</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>&gt; On Jul 16, 2018, at 6:22 AM, Michael Mosher &lt;mjmx@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; TCS WOW four CV programming fails if either or both&gt; a) Allow caching when writing index CVs for read or write operations&gt; b) When possible, confirm CV writes by following them with a read&gt; is enabled.&gt; Would it be possible to disable those while doing a T2CV or T3CV operation then restore the settings after finished?&gt; If not then I can add note telling user to disable those settings.The run-time decision to use or not use confirm-reads is in java//src/jmri/jmrit/symbolicprog/tabbedframe/PaneProgFrame.java at line 479, in a block called "set the programming mode”The caching decision starts a few lines later and gets passed into the jmri.implementation.ProgrammerFacadeSelector. It could be intercepted in PaneProgFrame or handled lower down, but I recommend the former.So I’d implement this by adding another item to the &lt;programming&gt; element to control it, which is then picked up there to control those two options.  But I don’t have time to do it for a while.Bob--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Ken,I was thinking of Bob Jacobsens idea to have a dialog box that only allows the user to quit or start a new profile. I was interested to see if I was able to implement that, together with my idea of a button that would allow the user to change only the connection settings. I'm not sure I'm able to do it, but I'm interested to give it a try.And in order to figure out how to do that, I was trying to figure out what is happening then JMRI starts and where this particular code should go. I'm quite new to JMRI development so I have a lot to learn. But it seems to me that the connections are set up by JmriConfigurationManager at line 183 and that the error handling is some lines later. So what I'm tryin to figure out now is how to see if JMRI has valid connections and whenether these are able to open the ports.My goal with the dialog box is four things:* A quit button* A new profile button* A change connection button that doesn't allow changing any other settings except the connections.* A clear information message to the user that the problem could be because the connected device is unplugged or power off.RegardsDaniel2018-07-16 05:25 skrev Ken Cameron:&gt; Daniel,&gt; &gt; Spinning all those messages is not useful, but neither is trying to do &gt; much&gt; if your system connection is broken/off/disconnected. There is another&gt; thread about what you should (or shouldn't) be able to do that in &gt; condition.&gt; A number of us feel that the only meaningful thing is fixing the &gt; connection.&gt; If the intent was to simulate having a connection, we feel that&gt; configuration (profile) should have been selected instead. Our &gt; challenge is&gt; trying to figure out which of the ways this could work will lead to the&gt; least number of issues we have to support.&gt; &gt; I'm sure you've seen how many cases users have had with 4.10 and the&gt; changing of their usual defaults to Internal and the problems that has &gt; been.&gt; We are hoping to make that not the issue it has been.&gt; &gt; So what is your view from the problem you are having? We are looking &gt; for&gt; other ideas.&gt; &gt; -Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team&gt; <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a>&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>I was looking at what is happening when JMRI starts without being able to open the port, because the LocoBufferUSB is unplugged. I then noticed that I get about 64 warning messages every second in the NetBeans output window that says:loconet.LnPacketizer  WARN  - xmtHandler.notify() npe [LnPowerManager LnTrackStatusUpdateThread]It's only a warning message so it's not a big deal. But there is a lot of them and they continue to come until I quit JMRI. I don't know if these messages end up in the log, since I watch them in the output window in NetBeans. But I get curious about why something continues indefinitely trying to do something on LocoNet when there is no LocoNet connection, because the LocoBufferUSB is not plugged in.The reason for me to react on this is because these messages becomes spam that hides all the important stuff in the output window. With these messages, I have over 3000 messages in the output window, but without these messages I only have about 45 messages in the output window. But it's no big deal since I can quit JMRI and copy the contents of the console window to a text editor and watch the important stuff in the editor.My configuration is a Digitrax Zephyr Extra and a LocoBufferUSB. But LocoNetUSB not plugged in at the moment. JMRI version 4.13.1ish+daniel+20180716T0229Z.RegardsDaniel</pre></td>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>One thing that would help the user a lot is a clear information message that this error could be because the SPROG/Commandstation/LocoBuffer is not power on or not connected to the computer.A message that tells the user that the port is not available does not nessesarily tells the user what is wrong. A message that tells the user to check whenether the commandstation/sprog/locobuffer is connected and power on would help many users, including myself.It's easy to think that the user is stupid, but I have made a lot of very stupid errors myself. And a reminder to connect the sprog and power on the sprog helps.------Another question:Would it be possible for JMRI to do a simple test of the port when the user saves the settings? Lets say the user had selected Digitrax Zephyr connected with a LocoBufferUSB. Then JMRI could open the port and read slot 1 before saving the settings. That would give a hint whenether the port and the central is correct. If the answer from the port is bad, either the central unit or the port is wrong and JMRI could warn the user that something is wrong.RegardsDaniel2018-07-14 03:53 skrev Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers:&gt; Absolutely agree the solution I mentioned is flawed.  As far as I&gt; know, _all_ solutions have the same underlying flaw:  Some JMRI users&gt; are going to not understand their options when something unexpected &amp;&gt; out of the ordinary happens.&gt; &gt; For example, let’s say there’s a special case for changing just the&gt; port.  Now somebody forgets to plug in their SPROG, and does the&gt; obvious thing, which is to switch the preferences to the other visible&gt; port, perhaps a built-in modem, and save them.  Completely reasonable&gt; thing from their point of view:  The port info got lost, and I just&gt; restored it to the obviously-correct choice!  All good!  Oh, wait,&gt; still not working. I’ll start a JMRI users thread on “PanelPro&gt; suddenly can’t talk to command station” and not mention I changed the&gt; port selection until my 12th post.&gt; &gt; Similar with any kind of auto-simulator approach:  It’ll work for some&gt; people, but it’ll fail in subtle ways for others because the&gt; simulators are never going to be perfect.  (Two-sensor turnout&gt; feedback anyone?)  In my opinion, you’ll have harder support issues if&gt; you try to chase that.&gt; &gt; We’ve been around this discussion enough times without finding a&gt; solution that works for all cases that I now believe there probably&gt; isn’t one. But I certainly could be wrong.  It would be great if&gt; somebody wanted to code an alternative that we can build and have&gt; people try it.&gt; &gt; Bob&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt; On Jul 13, 2018, at 5:22 PM, Dave Heap &lt;dgheap@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Bob,&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; I'd back a version of your solution any day. We have simulators and &gt;&gt; profiles for the "away from layout" situation.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Fallback to Internal is causing us too much ongoing support load and &gt;&gt; much user frustration.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; But as it stands, your suggestion has a flaw. What about the situation &gt;&gt; where the user genuinely needs to change the port selection because it &gt;&gt; has changed due to hardware/operating system reasons?&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; --&gt;&gt; Dave&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt; On Jul 13, 2018, at 6:32 PM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; &gt;&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; You would not be the only one in favor of that solution.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; The only other tool that would be nice to go with that is a one button &gt;&gt; to&gt;&gt; make a 'Simulator' version of whatever profile you have, sharing &gt;&gt; everything&gt;&gt; else with the existing profile. It would be I real feather if &gt;&gt; something like&gt;&gt; that could be made. But the problem I see is how to identify in the &gt;&gt; program&gt;&gt; that this system connection has a simulator available. There are some &gt;&gt; that&gt;&gt; don't, at least I think there are still a few that don't.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; -Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; --&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>
