            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36368233/">Re: [Jmri-developers] NCE Status</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Dave Heap &lt;dgheap@gm...&gt; - 2018-07-15 03:00:02</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> <b>Attachments:</b> <a href="/p/jmri/mailman/attachment/72BAF3B2-52CA-43D4-9F05-E3FE0BAFE4DE%40gmail.com/1/">Message as HTML</a> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Dan,I'm sure we'd welcome that. I don't have time to delve into it.In the past few days I discovered that the USB-based systems accept but ignore NCE's A2 Consist Control commands.The A2 Consist Control commands on the Power Pro do two things:1) Update the command station's Consist Table.2) Send an NMRA S9.2.1 Consist Control instruction to loco(s) as appropriate.We can fudge (1) with memory access commands but (2) is a problem. The USB-based systems don't have a sendPacket command so we'd have to fudge by sending POM CV19 commands instead.The behaviour of Consist Control commands in the decoder versus POM CV16 can differ between decoder brands/models. For example ESU decoders allow Consist Control to change CV19 in a locked decoder, but POM CV19 is disallowed.Sent from my iPad-- Dave in AustraliaThe New England Convention 2018<a href="http://www.newenglandmodelrailwayclub.com/content/convention.shtml" rel="nofollow">http://www.newenglandmodelrailwayclub.com/content/convention.shtml</a>&gt; On 15 Jul 2018, at 10:08 AM, Dan Boudreau &lt;daboudreau@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Thanks Ken,&gt; &gt; I'll take a look at the NCE stuff and see if I can figure out how to fix it.&gt; &gt; Dan</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>I suggest that the log always shows the date and time when the connection was last changed. If a user changes the connection and then tells you that something doesn't work, you will at least see when the change of the connection was made.I suggest that when the settings are saved, JMRI does a check to see if anything in the connection settings has changed and if so, saves the date and time.RegardsDaniel2018-07-14 03:53 skrev Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers:&gt; Absolutely agree the solution I mentioned is flawed.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Sounds good (though I have no idea at all where to start setting this up).The current tool is simply a .jar file, run from the Terminal using flags for a range of options.There was a separate discussion in PR #7 on integrating the function of XCR into PP, but that would require versioning of the XCR jar first. For now that's just another reason to use the GH Release system. Will discuss the details off-list.Egbert&gt; Op 14 jul. 2018, om 18:29 heeft jmri-developers-request@... het volgende geschreven:&gt; &gt; Van: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@... &lt;mailto:jacobsen@...&gt;&gt;&gt; Datum: 14 juli 2018 om 18:29:37 CEST&gt; &gt; If you have time to set it up (I can help), I think the best approach to distributing XCR is via the GitHub release system:  <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/XTrkCadReader/releases" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/XTrkCadReader/releases</a> &lt;<a href="https://github.com/JMRI/XTrkCadReader/releases>" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/XTrkCadReader/releases&gt;</a>;&gt; &gt; That combines a tag on a particular set of source files with the distribution files in a clean way.  Then links in other places can point to those files.&gt; &gt; Does that sound like the right approach for this tool? (I’m not a user, might be missing something)&gt; &gt; Bob</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>If you have time to set it up (I can help), I think the best approach to distributing XCR is via the GitHub release system:  <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/XTrkCadReader/releases" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/XTrkCadReader/releases</a>That combines a tag on a particular set of source files with the distribution files in a clean way.  Then links in other places can point to those files.Does that sound like the right approach for this tool? (I’m not a user, might be missing something)Bob&gt; On Jul 14, 2018, at 7:33 AM, dcc2 &lt;dcc2@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; I've created PR #8 for JMRI/XtrkCadReader v2.2.2, fixing an exception reading the current XTrackCAD v4/5 file format.&gt; Is someone able to review &amp; merge this PR?&gt; &gt; The PR only takes care of the source code repo.&gt; To provide the new xtrkcadreader.jar as a download, we still have to make it available outside of GitHub (it is attached to the PR as a ZIP file).&gt; The previous jar is at the following location on sourceforge: <a href="https://sourceforge.net/projects/jmri/files/XtrkCadReader/" rel="nofollow">https://sourceforge.net/projects/jmri/files/XtrkCadReader/</a>&gt; Now it looks like the info shown on that page around the downloads is very dated, and it needs clean-up.          <td class="email-body"><pre>And in response to Ken's question, no. The Internal is selected and remains that way on a subsequent restart, even if all the "Save" offerings have been declined.I don't know if in fact it is secretly doing a Save, or if it clears the Defaults on restarting - I'll investigate more.I appreciate the need to have a Simulator situation - it deserves its own deliberately created profile, which is what I believe most people do.I also very much appreciate the need to be able to set a new Port (Thank you so much, Windows!) as this catches out many users.What I do not understand is why Internal is selected when the immediate previous condition was not that way. Something makes that happen, and I am not enough of a coder to dig in and find it.BillBill Chownorrrbrit2004@...<a href="comhttp://sprog.us.com/" rel="nofollow">comhttp://sprog.us.com/</a>     On Saturday, July 14, 2018, 4:21:54 AM PDT, Andrew Crosland &lt;andrew@...&gt; wrote:    That's fine for Bill, or myself, or most people on this list who understand what's going on.Most users just don't understand what's going on. They know something has changed and are prompted to save changes. Very often, they will do so.A simple mistake (not powering or connecting the interface) results in the whole profile being trashed so that when the interface is connected it *still* doesn't work. That's when they ask for help or start bitching that we have changed how JMRI works. We should be helping users arrive at the correct setup, not putting further barriers in their way.There was a thread recently on the MERG forum where some users swear blind that the default settings of the JMRI "defaults" have been deliberately changed to always select "internal" when a new connection is created. They will not accept that they have done something wrong during or subsequent to the initial setup.Andrew------ Original Message ------From: "Ken Cameron" &lt;kcameron@...&gt;To: "'Bill Chown'" &lt;orrrbrit2004@...&gt;; "'Discussions between JMRI developers'" &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt;Sent: 14/07/2018 02:27:07Subject: Re: [Jmri-developers] First 4.12 files available&gt;Bill C,&gt;&gt;As long as you don't save the preferences, it should still have your &gt;prior&gt;settings next time you start.          <td class="email-body"><pre>That's fine for Bill, or myself, or most people on this list who understand what's going on.Most users just don't understand what's going on. They know something has changed and are prompted to save changes. Very often, they will do so.A simple mistake (not powering or connecting the interface) results in the whole profile being trashed so that when the interface is connected it *still* doesn't work. That's when they ask for help or start bitching that we have changed how JMRI works. We should be helping users arrive at the correct setup, not putting further barriers in their way.There was a thread recently on the MERG forum where some users swear blind that the default settings of the JMRI "defaults" have been deliberately changed to always select "internal" when a new connection is created. They will not accept that they have done something wrong during or subsequent to the initial setup.Andrew------ Original Message ------From: "Ken Cameron" &lt;kcameron@...&gt;To: "'Bill Chown'" &lt;orrrbrit2004@...&gt;; "'Discussions between JMRI developers'" &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt;Sent: 14/07/2018 02:27:07Subject: Re: [Jmri-developers] First 4.12 files available&gt;Bill C,&gt;&gt;As long as you don't save the preferences, it should still have your &gt;prior&gt;settings next time you start.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,I think one of the issues here is that if a port wasn't valid when JMRIstarted, we don't have a way to say "invoke the method that finds all theports". If the code could finally do this, we could say we didn't find whatwas configured, but give a prompt about the problem. The user could try tocorrect the physical issue (plug it in, turn it on). Then hit the 'tryagain' button.Unfortunately it is much simpler to exit and try again.With the defaults, I think our issue is we currently change it to a workingconnection (Internal when all else failed). Preventing changes to thedefaults, except by user direct action, might be a way. But part of thiswould be requiring them to review the defaults every time the connectionschange. But as I recall, right after you add a connection, it doesn't existuntil you reboot, so it isn't in the defaults list yet. Or is this betterthese days?I'm just trying to think of different ways of thinking about this conundrumand hope either I or someone reading this with find a better way than how itworks today.-Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a> <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a> <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a> <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a></pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>It's covered by creating a new profile for the new port, albeit with more work for the user.The key is the message we give the user. Explain that the configured port is not available and they can quit - fix the port problem - restart or create a new profile using the new port.We also need to ensure that the failing profile is not set to autorun without showing the profile selector.Andrew------ Original Message ------From: "Dave Heap" &lt;dgheap@...&gt;To: "Discussions between JMRI developers" &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt;Sent: 14/07/2018 01:22:47Subject: Re: [Jmri-developers] Defaults (was Re: First 4.12 files available&gt;But as it stands, your suggestion has a flaw.          <td class="email-body"><pre>I suppose that this is about the issue I wrote about on 1st May 2018:"I have had problems with the JMRI when using USB ports.After many problems as the computer (Windows or Ubuntu)seems to pick new USB ports as "a lottery" and the resulthas been that JMRI is dropping off turnouts and some otherrequired items at new starts.I have moved to Ethernet connection (I do not know ifTams is supporting Ethernet) as it is reliable if youdo remember to start the Ethernet first in your network.ESU ECoS and JMRI and MERG support Ethernet connections.With Ethernet you may have 4 concurrent connections.I think it is a bug in the JMRI if it really drops outitems you have been using earlier. I do not check thatany more as I am using only Ethernet connection to JMRI."There should be a message to start over and pick up theright USB port before the JMRI does anything for your file.Kai "Waiski" Vehmersalo, Finland###On 14.07.2018 07:32, db123@... wrote:&gt; I would appreciate your solution a lot.&gt;&gt; About the question about the wrong port:&gt;&gt; Maybe it would be possible for your dialog to have a button "Edit &gt; Connection" that shows ONLY the connection dialog in the settings &gt; dialog.         <tr> 
         <td class="email-header"> 
          <div> 
           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36367744/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Defaults (was Re: First 4.12 files available</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@ma...&gt; - 2018-07-14 01:54:04</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Absolutely agree the solution I mentioned is flawed.  As far as I know, _all_ solutions have the same underlying flaw:  Some JMRI users are going to not understand their options when something unexpected &amp; out of the ordinary happens.  For example, let’s say there’s a special case for changing just the port.  Now somebody forgets to plug in their SPROG, and does the obvious thing, which is to switch the preferences to the other visible port, perhaps a built-in modem, and save them.  Completely reasonable thing from their point of view:  The port info got lost, and I just restored it to the obviously-correct choice!  All good!  Oh, wait, still not working. I’ll start a JMRI users thread on “PanelPro suddenly can’t talk to command station” and not mention I changed the port selection until my 12th post.Similar with any kind of auto-simulator approach:  It’ll work for some people, but it’ll fail in subtle ways for others because the simulators are never going to be perfect.  (Two-sensor turnout feedback anyone?)  In my opinion, you’ll have harder support issues if you try to chase that.We’ve been around this discussion enough times without finding a solution that works for all cases that I now believe there probably isn’t one. But I certainly could be wrong.  It would be great if somebody wanted to code an alternative that we can build and have people try it.Bob&gt; On Jul 13, 2018, at 5:22 PM, Dave Heap &lt;dgheap@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Bob,&gt; &gt; I'd back a version of your solution any day. We have simulators and profiles for the "away from layout" situation.&gt; &gt; Fallback to Internal is causing us too much ongoing support load and much user frustration.&gt; &gt; But as it stands, your suggestion has a flaw. What about the situation where the user genuinely needs to change the port selection because it has changed due to hardware/operating system reasons?&gt; &gt; -- &gt; Dave&gt; On Jul 13, 2018, at 6:32 PM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; You would not be the only one in favor of that solution. &gt; &gt; The only other tool that would be nice to go with that is a one button to&gt; make a 'Simulator' version of whatever profile you have, sharing everything&gt; else with the existing profile. It would be I real feather if something like&gt; that could be made. But the problem I see is how to identify in the program&gt; that this system connection has a simulator available. There are some that&gt; don't, at least I think there are still a few that don't.&gt; &gt; -Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-header">

           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36367736/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Defaults (was Re: First 4.12 files available</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@tw...&gt; - 2018-07-14 01:36:11</small>

          </div> </td>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob J,You would not be the only one in favor of that solution. The only other tool that would be nice to go with that is a one button tomake a 'Simulator' version of whatever profile you have, sharing everythingelse with the existing profile. It would be I real feather if something likethat could be made. But the problem I see is how to identify in the programthat this system connection has a simulator available. There are some thatdon't, at least I think there are still a few that don't.-Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a> <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a> <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a> <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a></pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,I'd back a version of your solution any day. We have simulators and profiles for the "away from layout" situation.Fallback to Internal is causing us too much ongoing support load and much user frustration.But as it stands, your suggestion has a flaw. What about the situation where the user genuinely needs to change the port selection because it has changed due to hardware/operating system reasons?Sent from my iPad-- Dave&gt; On 14 Jul 2018, at 9:44 AM, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; I have half a mind to just code up the solution I like (but nobody else does), which is that if you have a connection configured in a profile and the port isn’t found, the program posts a dialog box that _only_ allows you to quit or start with a new profile. Every other solution I know of presents opportunities for people to mess up their preferences.</pre></td>
        </tr>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>I expect we’ll be going round about this forever, because there are people who have different views about how it should work.  We certainly discuss it enough. What’s there now is (at least) the fourth iteration. What you see as a problem, others see as “How do I cope with starting the program away from my hardware?"I have half a mind to just code up the solution I like (but nobody else does), which is that if you have a connection configured in a profile and the port isn’t found, the program posts a dialog box that _only_ allows you to quit or start with a new profile. Every other solution I know of presents opportunities for people to mess up their preferences.Bob&gt; On Jul 13, 2018, at 3:10 PM, Bill Chown via Jmri-developers &lt;jmri-developers@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Tested 4.12 with SPROG 3 and Windows 10, and all works fine - eventually.&gt; But&gt; the DEFAULTS disaster still raises its ugly head.&gt; A startup of DecoderPro with device connected and all works fine.&gt; Change around some things, and forget to plug in the SPROG again, and the error message appears that the connection was not found&gt;  "&gt; 	• Unable to create connection "SPROG Command Station" (S).&gt; 	•     Serial port COM4 not found.Serial port COM4 not found.&gt; 	• System connection SPROG Command Station provides a null manager for interface jmri.CommandStation&gt; 	• Unable to run startup actions due to earlier failures. &gt; " and the Preferences Connections pane is opened.&gt; OK, fair enough, but there is no warning that the Defaults were also all dropped to the fictitious "Internal" service.&gt; Why does this happen? I thought that something was done about this, but just removing the previously somewhat useful "The Defaults are incorrect" message does not really do it!&gt; Cannot the Defaults be left as they were?&gt; &gt; I understand that in the absence of a device someone might want to use a Profile deliberately set up for "Simulate" with the internal settings, but that should not be forced upon every user who just omits a power cord.&gt; &gt; Bill&gt; &gt; &gt; Bill Chown&gt; orrrbrit2004@...&gt; <a href="http://bchown.com/" rel="nofollow">http://bchown.com/</a>&gt; &gt; --Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>
        </tr>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Hi KenActually its not that much code and the warning only appears for every tenon-off, or off-on states has happened. A lot of newer sensor hardware has this built in. A classic example of its useis Pizza Cutter wheels sending sensors  high for a micro second or two on nearbytrack, or small outages on the loco when its cruises on the flywheel sending thesensor low.Steve G.&gt; ---------- Original Message ----------&gt; From: Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt;&gt; Date: July 6, 2018 at 8:31 PM&gt; &gt; &gt; Steve G,&gt; &gt; So the flapping message is anytime there is bouncing of the raw input?&gt; Granted in my case with the longer interval, it is likely to have a higher&gt; number of counts. But that's what the debouncing is supposed to deal with,&gt; I've seen inputs that will show 10-30 edges for a square wave that is 60 hz,&gt; lots of noise coming on or off.&gt; &gt; I guess the flapping is just a step a debounce function doesn't need. Noisy&gt; inputs is the nature of their game. Saying the input is noisy isn't&gt; something I'd see as a meaningful feature. The user should know if their&gt; input is noisy or not. I was surprised at how much code was put in to track&gt; this added feature.&gt; &gt; -Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team&gt; <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a>&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Copy Conditional:  Great idea and a very useful tool on the route toeventual reusable JMRI code.My CTC environment has about 20 basic conditionals replicated an average of70 times each.  Some are replicated only a 8 - 10 times and a few over 100times.  Copy Conditional is a great place to start.  Eventually I hope wecan have a passed Conditional Data Structure that contains all thereferenced variables, but Copy Conditional fits right in with the concept.I reviewed the project description below and it brought me back to thecurrent reality of how irrational and difficult to deal with the JMRI Beantable environment has become.  Paul Bender is (I think) adding the GUI toBob J.'s Event Mast (Turnout Mast like, but with Events).  I wonder if thesupporting Event table will be a new public Event table of a hidden privatetable.David ParksLos Altos, CA-----Original Message-----From: Chuck Catania [mailto:cpcrr@...] Sent: Saturday, July 7, 2018 8:17 AMTo: Jmri-developers@...; Dave SandSubject: Re: [Jmri-developers] 4.13.x ProjectsDave,I would like to see a Copy Conditional function added to Logix.I envision this function presenting the selected conditional parameterswith drop down pick lists for each of the table objects in the AntecedentVariables and Consequent Actions panes.  The function would emit conditionalcode (with a new name) as if a New Conditional had been created.  Manyconditionals within a Logix are similar in function, only differing invariable names.Chuck CataniaOn Jul 7, 2018, at 7:39 AM, Dave Sand &lt;dave@...&gt; wrote:&gt; I have two project ideas that I would like to work on.&gt; &gt; 1) Retire Orignal Order&gt; &gt; The original order concept was discussed last August and again inFebruary.  There are six objects that explicitly maintain original order:Audio, Light, Memory, Reporter, Sensor and Turnout.  I propose usinggetNamedBeanSet which returns the _beans TreeSet.&gt; &gt; &gt; 2) Bean Name Management&gt; &gt; Project description:&gt; &gt; ----------------------------&gt; &gt; Proposed changes for Bean names&gt; &gt; Centralize Name Management&gt; &gt; The appropriate manager is responsible for system and user names.&gt; 	. System name normalization&gt; 	. System name duplicate checks&gt; 	. User name normalization&gt; 	. User name duplicate checks&gt; 	. User name changes&gt; &gt; &gt; Exceptions&gt; &gt; The name process is exception based.  For system and user name validation,only valid names are returned.  For the create process, only a new bean isreturned.  For user name changes, the resulting user name is returned.&gt; &gt; If an action cannot be completed, a JmriException is thrown.  Theexception message format is reason~name.&gt; &gt; Reasons:&gt; 	. BadSysName&gt; 	. DupSysName&gt; 	. BadUserName&gt; 	. DupUserName&gt; 	. NameAsPrefix&gt; 	. CreateFailed&gt; &gt; The reason codes are Bundle keys for creating error messages and dialogs.The keys are defined in jmri/jmrit/Bundle.properties.&gt; &gt; &gt; Calling Process Changes&gt; &gt; The name handling is simplified by delegating the name normalization andduplicate checks to the manager.   The calling process handles the nameinput and response notification to the user.&gt; &gt; If the bean create was successful the new bean is returned and the callingprocess gets the final system and user names from the bean.&gt; &gt; The names from panel xml files bypass the name normalization andvalidation since they cannot be changed.&gt; &gt; &gt; BeanTableDataModel&gt; &gt; Handles post create functions&gt; &gt; Context menu&gt; 	. Rename - also edit screen / conditional edit window&gt; 	. Remove - includes option to remove reference (handle)&gt; 	. Move&gt; 	. Delete - also row button&gt; &gt; Rename to blank?  Should that be the same as remove?&gt; &gt; --------------------&gt; &gt; The scope of this project is very large.  To minimize impact I seesplitting this project into sub-projects by bean.  I plan to start with thesimple beans that I have already worked with such as Logix and Routes.Logix was my test case and could be included in 4.13.1.  Additional beanswould be added in subsequent test releases.&gt; &gt; Dave Sand&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org!<a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot_______________________________________________" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot_______________________________________________</a>&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36362437/">[Jmri-developers] 4.13.x Projects</a></b>

           <small>From: Dave Sand &lt;dave@sa...&gt; - 2018-07-07 14:40:02</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> <b>Attachments:</b> <a href="/p/jmri/mailman/attachment/C9E815A4-66BD-4085-B561-3CC64A7B6D03%40sandsys.org/1/">Message as HTML</a> </small>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>I have two project ideas that I would like to work on.1) Retire Orignal OrderThe original order concept was discussed last August and again in February.  There are six objects that explicitly maintain original order:  Audio, Light, Memory, Reporter, Sensor and Turnout.  I propose using getNamedBeanSet which returns the _beans TreeSet.2) Bean Name ManagementProject description:————————————————————————————Proposed changes for Bean namesCentralize Name ManagementThe appropriate manager is responsible for system and user names.System name normalizationSystem name duplicate checksUser name normalizationUser name duplicate checksUser name changesExceptionsThe name process is exception based.  For system and user name validation, only valid names are returned.  For the create process, only a new bean is returned.  For user name changes, the resulting user name is returned.If an action cannot be completed, a JmriException is thrown.  The exception message format is reason~name.Reasons:BadSysNameDupSysNameBadUserNameDupUserNameNameAsPrefixCreateFailedThe reason codes are Bundle keys for creating error messages and dialogs.  The keys are defined in jmri/jmrit/Bundle.properties.Calling Process ChangesThe name handling is simplified by delegating the name normalization and duplicate checks to the manager.   The calling process handles the name input and response notification to the user.If the bean create was successful the new bean is returned and the calling process gets the final system and user names from the bean.The names from panel xml files bypass the name normalization and validation since they cannot be changed.BeanTableDataModelHandles post create functionsContext menuRename — also edit screen / conditional edit windowRemove — includes option to remove reference (handle)MoveDelete — also row buttonRename to blank?  Should that be the same as remove?————————————————————The scope of this project is very large.  To minimize impact I see splitting this project into sub-projects by bean.  I plan to start with the simple beans that I have already worked with such as Logix and Routes.  Logix was my test case and could be included in 4.13.1.  Additional beans would be added in subsequent test releases.Dave Sand</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>See my post earlier - for me the issue is that in the edit sensor and edit block dialogues you can't enter valid values that are accepted in the table view.  One to two seconds is not an unreasonable inactive debounce value for a block detector and at the moment you cannot enter anything over 1 second - an arbitrary value which must have been introduced in error at some point.This is a regression, because it used to work fine in earlier versions of JMRI.I agree that it is not urgent enough for 4.12 as there is an easy workaround for users,  but IMHO we should fix it during the next release cycle.On 07/07/2018 01:31, Bob Jacobsen via Jmri-developers wrote:&gt; I agree that we should show the actual value properly.  I don’t consider it a high priority, but perhaps somebody else will.&gt;&gt; But your application isn’t what that feature was meant to do, and quite likely it won’t work well.  Debouncing is meant to make sure that an input only follows consistent changes, not that it stay on for a long time.  If you’re having it look at something that might stay on, or might go on and off, there’s no guarantee that it’ll always produce the function you intend.&gt;&gt; Bob&gt;&gt;&gt; On Jul 6, 2018, at 4:04 PM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; In this case I was considering an internal sensor that was the OR of a&gt;&gt; couple of motion sensors around a layout. It would keep the layout running&gt;&gt; for 5 minutes after the last trigger from any of the motion sensors. Logix&gt;&gt; was providing the OR of the motion sensors. So rather than using the&gt;&gt; DebounceSensor.py, I figured I'd try the build in feature.&gt; --&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>
        </tr>

      <table id="msg36362219">
       <tbody>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-header"> 
          <div> 
           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36362219/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Sensor debounce settings</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: B. Milhaupt &lt;dccexperimenter@sb...&gt; - 2018-07-07 02:00:10</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>In the "industrial controls" industry, they design using a variety of "timer relays" which have different timing behaviors.  Two varieties are called "on-delay" and "off-delay", and these seem to relate to the topic at hand.  If I recall correctly, an "on-delay" relay (I may be using the wrong name here) waits for the "delay time" after the relay is powered before the coil energizes.  The power must be provided continuously during the "delay time" in order for the coil to become energized.  If the relay power goes away before the delay time, the coil remains de-energized.  As soon as the relay power disappears, the coil will de-energize.  An "off-delay" relay (IIRC) actuates the contacts as soon as the control input becomes powered, and remains closed for a time after the control input is de-powered.Ken seems to be describing a scenario where "off-delay" relay functionality is appropriate.  But the previous descriptions of JMRI functionality sounds like a logical-OR combination of "on-delay" relay functionality and "off-delay" relay functionality.  Using JMRI's "debounce" functionality would therefore seem to miss the desired functionality.JMRI "debouncing" of the motion detection input(s) may be a good part of the solution if spurious "false-motion" and spurious "false-non-motion" indications are seen.  A small "debounce time" of 100ms or 200ms could be suitable.  But Ken's basic functionality would seem to be best implemented using Logix.  A conditional would monitor the input(s).  An action "On Change To True" would propagate the input change (i.e. "motion seen") to the output sensor/turnout via a "Set Sensor/Turnout" action -and- a "Reset Delayed Set Sensor/Turnout" action (to stop the "off" timer).  Another action, "On Change To False", would perform a "Delayed Set Sensor/Turnout" with a delay of 60 seconds.I have made use of this basic construct many times in creating a highly-prototypical CTC implementation as well as a few other applications.(Now I'm wondering if Logix could/should include "canned" implementations of industrial-controls-style timing relays...)RegardsBob M.</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>When you’ve use debounce for it’s proper purpose, debouncing an input, you’ve never seen the “flapping message”.  And when you use it for something it’s not meant for, for which it’s likely to be unreliable, it warns you with this message.  Did I get that right?Sounds like the message is doing it’s job. It warns that changes are happening up the end of the timeout, such that the timeout isn’t sufficient to detect bouncing in that input.Bob&gt; On Jul 6, 2018, at 5:31 PM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Steve G,&gt; &gt; So the flapping message is anytime there is bouncing of the raw input?&gt; Granted in my case with the longer interval, it is likely to have a higher&gt; number of counts. But that's what the debouncing is supposed to deal with,&gt; I've seen inputs that will show 10-30 edges for a square wave that is 60 hz,&gt; lots of noise coming on or off.&gt; &gt; I guess the flapping is just a step a debounce function doesn't need. Noisy&gt; inputs is the nature of their game. Saying the input is noisy isn't&gt; something I'd see as a meaningful feature. The user should know if their&gt; input is noisy or not. I was surprised at how much code was put in to track&gt; this added feature.&gt; &gt; -Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team&gt; <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a>&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Steve G,So the flapping message is anytime there is bouncing of the raw input?Granted in my case with the longer interval, it is likely to have a highernumber of counts. But that's what the debouncing is supposed to deal with,I've seen inputs that will show 10-30 edges for a square wave that is 60 hz,lots of noise coming on or off.I guess the flapping is just a step a debounce function doesn't need. Noisyinputs is the nature of their game. Saying the input is noisy isn'tsomething I'd see as a meaningful feature. The user should know if theirinput is noisy or not. I was surprised at how much code was put in to trackthis added feature.-Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a> <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a> <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a> <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a></pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>I agree that we should show the actual value properly.  I don’t consider it a high priority, but perhaps somebody else will.  But your application isn’t what that feature was meant to do, and quite likely it won’t work well.  Debouncing is meant to make sure that an input only follows consistent changes, not that it stay on for a long time.  If you’re having it look at something that might stay on, or might go on and off, there’s no guarantee that it’ll always produce the function you intend.Bob&gt; On Jul 6, 2018, at 4:04 PM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; In this case I was considering an internal sensor that was the OR of a&gt; couple of motion sensors around a layout. It would keep the layout running&gt; for 5 minutes after the last trigger from any of the motion sensors. Logix&gt; was providing the OR of the motion sensors. So rather than using the&gt; DebounceSensor.py, I figured I'd try the build in feature.--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>HiFlapping is when it doesn't stay on or off. So sensor is triggered and if still on after x millisecs it's considered on. If it goes off again and on again during that period it's flapping, it doesn't know whether to reset the timer or ignore. It's not intended for the purpose to which you have assigned it. If I under stand correctly you need a timer that resets on every sensed  interrupt.Steve G.On July 6, 2018 7:04:23 PM EDT, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt;In this case I was considering an internal sensor that was the OR of a&gt;couple of motion sensors around a layout. It would keep the layout&gt;running&gt;for 5 minutes after the last trigger from any of the motion sensors.&gt;Logix&gt;was providing the OR of the motion sensors. So rather than using the&gt;DebounceSensor.py, I figured I'd try the build in feature.&gt;&gt;But it seems the different presentation of the values has issues.&gt;&gt;The other thing is once in a while I get a log message of:&gt;&gt;2018-07-06 11:46:13,682 implementation.AbstractSensor         WARN  -&gt;Sensor&gt;"MotionActive" state keeps flapping: 10 [AWT-EventQueue-0]&gt;2018-07-06 11:58:12,102 implementation.AbstractSensor         WARN  -&gt;Sensor&gt;"MotionActive" state keeps flapping: 20 [AWT-EventQueue-0]&gt;&gt;Anyone have a clue of what causes this?&gt;&gt;-Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team&gt;www.jmri.org&gt;www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org&gt;www.cnymod.com&gt;www.syracusemodelrr.org&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt;Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt;engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt;_______________________________________________&gt;Jmri-developers mailing list&gt;Jmri-developers@...&gt;<a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>-- Sent from my Android device with K-9 Mail. Please excuse my brevity.</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>I had a quick play, and a similar problem arises when editing the sensor debounce values in editing a block.In the sensor table, you can enter values in the thousands of milliseconds no problem - as Ken reports.If you edit a block, and go to the Sensor tab, it adds the comma separator as mentioned by Ken, but also the maximum value it will accept is 1000 (when it adds the comma) but if you enter 1001 or greater, the value just reverts to what was there before. I suspect this is using the same entry routine as the one that Ken found.It is quite normal to have longer inactive delays on block detectors, I set mine to typically 2 or 3 seconds.  I know this used to be fine, because I set up a lot of my block sensors that way, but I don't know at what version this ceased to work properly, it certainly isn't right now - although the workaround of doing it in the sensor table is simple enough.And of course, there will always be specialised applications where you might want a really long sensor off time, such as the 60 seconds that Ken mentioned, so we shouldn't be restricting its value to anything other than what the underlying variable can store.Regards,PeteOn 06/07/2018 16:57, Ken Cameron wrote:&gt; I did some playing, I think there is an issue between some parts displaying&gt; with separators (thousands) and some parts not.&gt;&gt; If I edited it via the table display, it doesn't show the separators. And I&gt; could enter values like 300000, 5 minutes. In the 'edit' on the individual&gt; sensor, it displays it as 300,000, which doesn't fit the fixed width box&gt; very well. Using the inc/dec arrows doesn't work on a value if the separator&gt; is in the box.&gt;&gt; So I think the general question becomes should the inc/dec understand the&gt; separators or should it never put them in in the first place?&gt;&gt; I'm guessing the test of the code never tried a couple of seconds for the&gt; values, or it wasn't done via the screen interface to note this issue.&gt;&gt; -Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team&gt; <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a>&gt; <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a>&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>&gt;&gt;</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>We have (at least) three changes to make before JMRI 4.12:#5525 Modify CPE Pallete to handle sorted lists#5514 Add Missing properties (fix a crash due to missing resource in properties file)#5512 Apply LE panel name change to Track Drawing OptionsIn the meantime, we’re still not merging PRs to master.I propose:*) Later this evening or early tomorrow, I’ll merge those three PRs. (The delay is so people can comment on the plan if they’d like to) Jenkins will then build 4.11.9-ish development packages. *) We ask the people who reported those three problems to check them.  That addresses whether they’re fixed, but not whether they introduce any new issues.*) Maybe Sunday, I build 4.11.9 and release it for a bit of more general testing.  *) At that point, I think we’re pretty converged, and we can start merging PRs to master again.*) Assuming that’s OK, 4.12 would follow at the end of that week (about two weeks from now), with 4.13.1 including all the other changes right after.Is this OK?  Anybody else have a (small and reliable) fix of a recent regression they’d like included in 4.11.9 in addition to those three?Bob--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Bob,Sounds like a good plan.  I would as part of the announcement state that this is our final test version and the more folks that download and try it will help us confirm that we have our production version.Dan&gt; -----Original Message-----&gt; From: Bob Jacobsen [mailto:jacobsen@...]&gt; Sent: Saturday, June 30, 2018 5:46 PM&gt; To: Discussions between JMRI developers &lt;jmri-&gt; developers@...&gt;&gt; Subject: [Jmri-developers] Contents and timing of JMRI 4.12 (was re: Contents&gt; and timing of JMRI 4.11.8&gt; &gt; JMRI 4.11.8 is out, I’ll send the email shortly.&gt; &gt; The plan is to build production JMRI 4.12 from _exactly_ this, unless there’s a&gt; newly discovered regression.&gt; &gt; The question is then:  How long to wait?&gt; &gt; *) Longer - more chance to find (and even fix!) any yet-to-be-discovered&gt; regression, but the more inconvenient it is for developers (No merges until it’s&gt; out!          <td class="email-body"><pre>JMRI 4.11.8 is out, I’ll send the email shortly.The plan is to build production JMRI 4.12 from _exactly_ this, unless there’s a newly discovered regression. The question is then:  How long to wait?*) Longer - more chance to find (and even fix!) any yet-to-be-discovered regression, but the more inconvenient it is for developers (No merges until it’s out! Please do your work on some branch _other_ than the master branch)*) Shorter - might not find things, but can get back to our usual processHow about 10 days?Bob--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36355226/">Re: [Jmri-developers] First 4.11.8 files</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Dave Heap &lt;dgheap@gm...&gt; - 2018-06-28 22:22:58</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> <b>Attachments:</b> <a href="/p/jmri/mailman/attachment/569E2F59-E433-443C-9261-120617334592%40gmail.com/1/">Message as HTML</a> </small> 
           </div>

        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>The creation of a UUID is a one-off operation (per machine/OS partition) when moving from V4.10 or earlier to a UUID-based V4.11.x or greater release.The migration will then happen once-off for each profile opened on that machine.There is a preexistent issue (before UUID) with reading the User Files Location from the old UserPrefsProfileConfig.xml file:<a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/issues/5184" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/issues/5184</a>I suspect that is related to <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/issues/5474" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/issues/5474</a>The loss of stored window positions from a migration is probably related to when the migration copy occurs within the startup and preferences procedures but I wouldn't relish trying to unravel that. It's of the nature of a one-off inconvenience.Sent from my iPad-- Dave&gt; On 29 Jun 2018, at 1:00 AM, Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; Thank you for the detail on this.&gt; &gt; If anybody thinks this is a killer problem, please comment, otherwise we’ll go forward with this as part of 4.11.8&gt; &gt; Is this a permanent migration (i.e. there’s not expected to be any changes from now on, this is just the way it is), or a temporary thing pending another update? Happy either way, just want to know how to write the release note.&gt; &gt; Bob&gt; &gt;&gt; On Jun 26, 2018, at 3:19 PM, Dave Sand &lt;dave@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; My usual set of tests worked as expected, including the LE line size changes, except for some minor node identity issues.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; The node identity change has different side effects based on the profile history.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; If the profile structure contains the UserPrefsProfileConfig.xml file (the predecessor to user-interface.xml) and the user files location has been moved out of the profile, then issue #5474 will occur.  This is a one time issue and can be resolved by doing a stop and re-start.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; If the profile structure does not contain the file, the user-interface.xml copy drops any classPreferences entries (normally message suppression requests) and all windowDetails entries except for the current windows which have reverted to their default locations.  For most people, this is just a matter of moving the windows and reselecting any class or window specific options.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; For people who regularly move between JMRI versions, the transition from a MAC identity, such as 4.10, will result in a new UUID identity.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Dave Sand&gt;&gt; &gt; --&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>One thing that bugs me about this bug, the rest of the screens on the maincomputer also stop updating. The trains stop moving, other Logix drivenevents stop updating. Even something simple like updating a count in amemory using a script line in a Logix stops updating it seems.I can understand something in Json causing the remote panels to fail, butthis is also causing the main panels to fail (freeze as doing updates).-Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a> <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a> <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a> <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a></pre></td>

Happy either way, just want to know how to write the release note.Bob&gt; On Jun 26, 2018, at 3:19 PM, Dave Sand &lt;dave@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; My usual set of tests worked as expected, including the LE line size changes, except for some minor node identity issues.&gt; &gt; &gt; The node identity change has different side effects based on the profile history.&gt; &gt; If the profile structure contains the UserPrefsProfileConfig.xml file (the predecessor to user-interface.xml) and the user files location has been moved out of the profile, then issue #5474 will occur.  This is a one time issue and can be resolved by doing a stop and re-start.&gt; &gt; If the profile structure does not contain the file, the user-interface.xml copy drops any classPreferences entries (normally message suppression requests) and all windowDetails entries except for the current windows which have reverted to their default locations.  For most people, this is just a matter of moving the windows and reselecting any class or window specific options.&gt; &gt; For people who regularly move between JMRI versions, the transition from a MAC identity, such as 4.10, will result in a new UUID identity.&gt; &gt;  &gt; Dave Sand&gt; --Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>My usual set of tests worked as expected, including the LE line size changes, except for some minor node identity issues.The node identity change has different side effects based on the profile history.If the profile structure contains the UserPrefsProfileConfig.xml file (the predecessor to user-interface.xml) and the user files location has been moved out of the profile, then issue #5474 will occur.  This is a one time issue and can be resolved by doing a stop and re-start.If the profile structure does not contain the file, the user-interface.xml copy drops any classPreferences entries (normally message suppression requests) and all windowDetails entries except for the current windows which have reverted to their default locations.  For most people, this is just a matter of moving the windows and reselecting any class or window specific options.For people who regularly move between JMRI versions, the transition from a MAC identity, such as 4.10, will result in a new UUID identity. Dave Sand&gt; On Jun 26, 2018, at 1:31 PM, Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; First JMRI 4.11.8 files are available in the usual way at:&gt; &gt; <a href="http://builds.jmri.org/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/4.11.8" rel="nofollow">http://builds.jmri.org/jenkins/job/TestReleases/job/4.11.8</a>&gt; &gt; It would be good if people can test these extensively before they’re released.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Agreed that it is a minor cosmetic change, and the user impact of not including it could be major for some users with panels migrating from 4.10 whose panels will no longer display correctly.  Whilst the work around for the user is not too difficult, it is most likely to affect the less experienced users who are not using blocks, who are less likely to understand what the problem is and how to fix it.Therefore to avoid breaking the display of existing panels migrating from 4.10, I would really like to see #5481 included - it is a very simple fix and I argued for it to be in 4.11.7 but as Dave says, we just missed the deadline.Regards,PeteOn 25/06/2018 22:45, Dave Sand wrote:&gt; Correct, this is a very minor cosmetic change to minimize user impact.&gt;&gt; Dave Sand&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On Jun 25, 2018, at 12:21 PM, Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Ok, Dave's comment about #5481 sounds like my definition of 'fixes' to&gt;&gt; 4.11.* changes to minimize impact on existing users.          <td class="email-body"><pre>Thanks Bob, that might give us a starting point.Regards,PeteOn 25/06/2018 16:19, Bob Jacobsen wrote:&gt; I don’t see any good examples of this in jython/, sorry.&gt;&gt; We use the JDOM library, which should be usable from scripts.  A bit of Java that you could perhaps use as a starting point (loosely from java/test/jmri/jmrit/decoderdefn/DuplicateTest.java and not guaranteed to run by itself)&gt;&gt;         jmri.jmrit.XmlFile xf = new jmri.jmrit.XmlFile() {&gt;          };   // odd syntax is due to XmlFile being abstract&gt;          Element root = xf.rootFromFile(new java.io.File(“filename.xml”));&gt;&gt; Then you can do things like (pseudo-Python)&gt;&gt; 	print root.getChild("decoder”)&gt;&gt; 	print root.getChild("decoder").getChild("family").getAttributeValue("name”)&gt;&gt; and when there’s more than one child of a name:&gt;&gt; 	list = root.getChildren(“foo”)&gt;&gt; then access the members of that list.&gt;&gt; Bob&gt;&gt;&gt; On Jun 25, 2018, at 7:59 AM, Pete Brownlow &lt;pete@...&gt; wrote:&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Can anyone point me towards an example of reading in and parsing an XML file (not my layout file) in a Jython script?&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; As JMRI uses XML extensively, I'm hoping I can access some library tools within JMRI to get me the tags and argument values without having to code all the parsing myself.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks,&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Pete&gt;&gt;&gt; --&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt;&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>

           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36352060/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Contents and timing of JMRI 4.11.8</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Dave Sand &lt;dave@sa...&gt; - 2018-06-25 16:30:04</small>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>#5481 is an interesting problem.It missed 4.11.7 by 24 hours due to discussions with PeteB.Its purpose is to minimize the visual impact of track changes for Layout Editor panels migrating to 4.12.  Without it, track without block assignments becomes very narrow.A detailed document is going to be posted to the user group files area with the release of 4.12 describing the changes to Layout Editor track drawing.  If people actually read the release notes and this document, this PR is not important.  In fact, it becomes unnecessary and can be cancelled since 4.13.1 is too late.I don’t see holding 4.12 for another 10 days.Dave Sand&gt; On Jun 25, 2018, at 10:11 AM, Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; We’ve accumulated a number of PRs for possible inclusion in JMRI 4.11.8.  See <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pulls" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pulls</a>&gt; &gt; Reminder:  Please _do_ _not_ merge PRs to master until we’ve sorted out the contents of 4.11.8 for 4.12.  Thank you.&gt; &gt; I’ve marked the documentation changes (which are pretty self-contained, particularly since most people encounter that on the web where it’s updated more quickly than a production release) and other self-contained changes for inclusion in JMRI 4.11.8 in a couple days.&gt; &gt; There are two marked as “after next production release”[1], i.e. currently headed for 4.13.1 instead of 4.12, that we should be sure of (every change has its proponents…):&gt; &gt; #5488 Update Shapes <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5488" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5488</a> (touches 21 Control Panel  Editor files)&gt; &gt;&gt; Remove decoration from prompt frame.&gt;&gt; Make behavior consistent for drawing and removing handles.&gt;&gt; General cleanup.&gt; &gt; #5481 Set rail defaults <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5481" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5481</a> (touches 3 Layout Editor files)&gt; &gt;&gt; Use layout editor track width and color settings for blocks and rails.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; If LayoutTrackDrawingOptions does not exist in the XML file, the above settings will be the default for creating the new LayoutTrackDrawingOptions.&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; If it does exist, its values will then be applied to rails and blocks.&gt; &gt; These both involve code and interface changes that we have in the past not made in the final test release(s) before a production release.  We decided to work that way after sequential production-release fiascos due to last-moment changes that hadn’t been exposed to the user community by being in earlier test releases.  But we can decide to change that practice.&gt; &gt; I think the choices are:&gt; &gt; 1) Go without these for 4.11.8 mid-week and then, assuming no problems, 4.12 will be out around July 2 or so. Test release 4.13.1 at about the same time would carry those two changes, along with other things (like the oft-mentioned OlcbSignalHead GUI changes)&gt; &gt; 2) Go with one or both of these (which?) in 4.11.8 mid-week and therefore let 4.11.8 cook with the user community for a while:  We ask people to take a look at the changed area(s) and try to get feedback.  Even assuming it’s OK, that means that 4.12 (and normal use of our master branch) will be delayed to maybe July 12 or so.&gt; &gt; There might be a third option I’ve not thought of, but I’m not willing to put out a 4.11.8 that includes one or more of those changes and almost immediately follow it by 4.12.  This volunteer thinks that’s a really poor work&amp;risk vs gain tradeoff. Perhaps somebody else wants to take that task, though.&gt; &gt; Bob&gt; &gt; <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22After+Next+Production+Release%22" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22After+Next+Production+Release%22</a>&gt; &gt; --&gt; Bob Jacobsen&gt; jacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG&gt; &gt; &gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a></pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>

      <table id="msg36352049">
       <tbody>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-header"> 
          <div> 
           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36352049/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Contents and timing of JMRI 4.11.8</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Ken Cameron &lt;kcameron@tw...&gt; - 2018-06-25 16:23:21</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>It seems that the key question (which I have due to the cloudy history ofthese updates) is how much of them were new features vs fixes to things donein the 4.11.* cycle that have disrupted existing users? If we've separatedthe bits that were cures to side effects of the development cycle, and thosewere in 4.11.7, then I see leaving them until 4.13.1 is the right path.However, if we are faced with those 'fixes' for existing users are notseparate, and can't be, then I'd agree that we'd need a 4.11.9-&gt;4.12 insteadof 4.11.8 being the 4.12 candidate. I'm just thinking scope of change and ifit is 'fixing' known compatibility issues, it is more likely to expose othercompatibility issues when we put it out there. OTOH, if either way we havefewer support issues that what 4.10 turned into (defaults=&gt;Internal) then,maybe we'd be ok. I'm just hoping we don't have the fallout like 4.10 seemedto turn into.Keeping other things for 4.13.1 is fine, since it will be out a month beforethe NMRA convention. I might add we consider that a 4.13.2 might be besttimed for just before the convention IF a number of changes are  added thatdirectly relate to content presenters are using for the convention. Here I'mthinking is issues related to the OLCB signal mast and related items comeup.-Ken Cameron, Member JMRI Dev Team <a href="http://www.jmri.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.jmri.org</a> <a href="http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.fingerlakeslivesteamers.org</a> <a href="http://www.cnymod.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.cnymod.com</a> <a href="http://www.syracusemodelrr.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.syracusemodelrr.org</a></pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36351987/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Reading XML from Jython</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@ma...&gt; - 2018-06-25 15:19:11</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small>

          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>I don’t see any good examples of this in jython/, sorry.We use the JDOM library, which should be usable from scripts.  A bit of Java that you could perhaps use as a starting point (loosely from java/test/jmri/jmrit/decoderdefn/DuplicateTest.java and not guaranteed to run by itself)       jmri.jmrit.XmlFile xf = new jmri.jmrit.XmlFile() {        };   // odd syntax is due to XmlFile being abstract        Element root = xf.rootFromFile(new java.io.File(“filename.xml”));Then you can do things like (pseudo-Python)	print root.getChild("decoder”)	print root.getChild("decoder").getChild("family").getAttributeValue("name”)and when there’s more than one child of a name:	list = root.getChildren(“foo”)then access the members of that list.Bob&gt; On Jun 25, 2018, at 7:59 AM, Pete Brownlow &lt;pete@...&gt; wrote:&gt; &gt; &gt; Can anyone point me towards an example of reading in and parsing an XML file (not my layout file) in a Jython script?&gt; &gt; As JMRI uses XML extensively, I'm hoping I can access some library tools within JMRI to get me the tags and argument values without having to code all the parsing myself.&gt; &gt; Thanks,&gt; &gt; Pete&gt; --Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table> 
      <table id="msg36351981">
       <tbody>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-header"> 
          <div> 
           <div>
            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36351981/">[Jmri-developers] Contents and timing of JMRI 4.11.8</a></b>
           </div> 
           <small>From: Bob Jacobsen &lt;jacobsen@ma...&gt; - 2018-06-25 15:11:17</small> 
           <div class="attachments"> 
            <small> </small> 
           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>We’ve accumulated a number of PRs for possible inclusion in JMRI 4.11.8.  See <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pulls" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pulls</a>Reminder:  Please _do_ _not_ merge PRs to master until we’ve sorted out the contents of 4.11.8 for 4.12.  Thank you.I’ve marked the documentation changes (which are pretty self-contained, particularly since most people encounter that on the web where it’s updated more quickly than a production release) and other self-contained changes for inclusion in JMRI 4.11.8 in a couple days.There are two marked as “after next production release”[1], i.e. currently headed for 4.13.1 instead of 4.12, that we should be sure of (every change has its proponents…):#5488 Update Shapes <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5488" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5488</a> (touches 21 Control Panel  Editor files)&gt; Remove decoration from prompt frame.&gt; Make behavior consistent for drawing and removing handles.&gt; General cleanup.#5481 Set rail defaults <a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5481" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pull/5481</a> (touches 3 Layout Editor files)&gt; Use layout editor track width and color settings for blocks and rails.&gt; &gt; If LayoutTrackDrawingOptions does not exist in the XML file, the above settings will be the default for creating the new LayoutTrackDrawingOptions.&gt; &gt; If it does exist, its values will then be applied to rails and blocks.These both involve code and interface changes that we have in the past not made in the final test release(s) before a production release.  We decided to work that way after sequential production-release fiascos due to last-moment changes that hadn’t been exposed to the user community by being in earlier test releases.  But we can decide to change that practice.I think the choices are:1) Go without these for 4.11.8 mid-week and then, assuming no problems, 4.12 will be out around July 2 or so. Test release 4.13.1 at about the same time would carry those two changes, along with other things (like the oft-mentioned OlcbSignalHead GUI changes)2) Go with one or both of these (which?) in 4.11.8 mid-week and therefore let 4.11.8 cook with the user community for a while:  We ask people to take a look at the changed area(s) and try to get feedback.  Even assuming it’s OK, that means that 4.12 (and normal use of our master branch) will be delayed to maybe July 12 or so.There might be a third option I’ve not thought of, but I’m not willing to put out a 4.11.8 that includes one or more of those changes and almost immediately follow it by 4.12.  This volunteer thinks that’s a really poor work&amp;risk vs gain tradeoff. Perhaps somebody else wants to take that task, though.Bob<a href="https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22After+Next+Production+Release%22" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22After+Next+Production+Release%22</a>--Bob Jacobsenjacobsen@... +1-510-708-5988 AIM, Skype JacobsenRG</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>DaveYes, good idea. Steve G.On June 19, 2018 4:53:51 PM EDT, Dave Sand &lt;dave@...&gt; wrote:&gt;With release 4.10, some of the color handling was changed from menu&gt;selections or combo box selections to the Java JColorChooser.  This was&gt;mostly in the Layout Editor domain.  This change removes the limitation&gt;of using the 13 named colors in the Java Color class.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;Now that nearly unlimited colors are available, what if a person just&gt;wants Red?  If they know the RGB color numbers, they can find it by&gt;looking at the tool tips.  Another issue is that the recent swatches&gt;are transient and not accessible from JMRI.&gt;&gt;My proposal is to extend JColorChooser and add a JMRI tab.  The JMRI&gt;tab would have buttons for the 13 standard colors and buttons for the&gt;colors that have been used in the current session.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;The standard color names are localized.  The initial set of recent&gt;colors is built during panel loading and updated as editing occurs.&gt;&gt;The existing compact color chooser would be updated to call the&gt;extended chooser.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;The extended chooser would also be available for embedded applications.&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;If the developer community thinks this is a good idea I will finish the&gt;project and submit it for 4.13.x.&gt;&gt;Dave Sand-- Sent from my Android device with K-9 Mail. Please excuse my brevity.</pre></td>

           </div> 
          </div> </td>
        </tr>
        <tr> 
         <td class="email-body"><pre>With release 4.10, some of the color handling was changed from menu selections or combo box selections to the Java JColorChooser.  This was mostly in the Layout Editor domain.  This change removes the limitation of using the 13 named colors in the Java Color class.Now that nearly unlimited colors are available, what if a person just wants Red?  If they know the RGB color numbers, they can find it by looking at the tool tips.  Another issue is that the recent swatches are transient and not accessible from JMRI.My proposal is to extend JColorChooser and add a JMRI tab.  The JMRI tab would have buttons for the 13 standard colors and buttons for the colors that have been used in the current session.The standard color names are localized.  The initial set of recent colors is built during panel loading and updated as editing occurs.The existing compact color chooser would be updated to call the extended chooser.The extended chooser would also be available for embedded applications.If the developer community thinks this is a good idea I will finish the project and submit it for 4.13.x.Dave Sand</pre></td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <td class="email-body"><pre>Pete,On the right-hand side of the pull request, click the gear icon and thenchoose from the list:[image: image.png]This facility is only available to those who are part of the JMRIorganisation on GitHub (I see that your GitHub user-id is, indeed, part ofthe JMRI organisation so it should be possible).Best regards,Matt HOn Tue, 19 Jun 2018 at 03:58, Cressman &lt;pgcressman@...&gt; wrote:&gt; How does one add  a label to a pull request?&gt;&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------&gt; Check out the vibrant tech community on one of the world's most&gt; engaging tech sites, Slashdot.org! <a href="http://sdm.link/slashdot" rel="nofollow">http://sdm.link/slashdot</a>&gt; _______________________________________________&gt; Jmri-developers mailing list&gt; Jmri-developers@...&gt; <a href="https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers" rel="nofollow">https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/jmri-developers</a>&gt;</pre></td>

            <b><a href="/p/jmri/mailman/message/36345208/">Re: [Jmri-developers] Release process (was Re: 4.11.7 and change to merging process</a></b>

           <small>From: Paul Bender &lt;paul.bender.phd@gm...&gt; - 2018-06-17 20:14:56</small>
